subject: Include empty default vars for package lists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-28 00:54:14.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Include empty default vars for package lists

The keystone role conditionally includes memcached_server as a
dependency. When that condition is not met, Ansible will skip all of the
tasks within this role, but will still attempt to evaluate the
'with_items' of tasks.

Add 'memcached_packages' and 'memcached_test_packages' to the role's
default variables as empty lists. Under normal circumstances these
will be overridden with variables through the distribution specific var
files.

Change-Id: I7aeaf3a0f7ad42c516d77fc608fdad4b3afe53a8
"}]
commit_message:
Include empty default vars for package lists

The keystone role conditionally includes memcached_server as a
dependency. When that condition is not met, Ansible will skip all of the
tasks within this role, but will still attempt to evaluate the
'with_items' of tasks.

Add 'memcached_packages' and 'memcached_test_packages' to the role's
default variables as empty lists. Under normal circumstances these
will be overridden with variables through the distribution specific var
files.

Change-Id: I7aeaf3a0f7ad42c516d77fc608fdad4b3afe53a8

commit_message:
New config parameters for PLUMgrid Neutron plugin

This patch set will enable PLUMgrid Neutron plugin
to switch to keystone v3. It also adds new parameter,
related to PLUMgrid metadata implemetation

Doc-ref: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PLUMgrid-Neutron

Change-Id: Ibf5b5f7430035291d7bb89fe6ec744746c909903
(cherry picked from commit a8b631e0972de6f965e43a02d64dba377e58490f)

[Ironic] Correct check for ready to deploy

Currently the check for whether the node is ready to deploy is
useless as it will always be true.

Closes-Bug: #1582680

subject: Fix "KeyError: u'instance_id'" in string format operation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16907, 'name': 'Diana Clarke', 'email': 'diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com', 'username': 'diana-clarke'}, {'_account_id': 19590, 'name': 'Sarafraj Singh', 'email': 'Sarafraj.Singh@intel.com', 'username': 'sarafrajsingh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 12:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_start_stop.py'], 'message': 'Fix "KeyError: u'instance_id'" in string format operation

Commit 56ac4418 removed the usage of mox in favor of mock. By mistake it
introduced the mocking of the kwarg "instance_uuid" which isn't part of
the format string of the InstanceNotFound exception. The error looks
like this:

    Exception in string format operation
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "nova/exception.py", line 140, in __init__
        message = self.msg_fmt % kwargs
    KeyError: u'instance_id'

This patch changes the mock to use "instance_id", which is the correct
kwarg for the format string of the InstanceNotFound exception. It also
uses the correct "uuids.instance" for this mock.

Change-Id: I6745075e186ad150a8ff1765dbece267e5cc2c5b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "KeyError: u'instance_id'" in string format operation

Commit 56ac4418 removed the usage of mox in favor of mock. By mistake it
introduced the mocking of the kwarg "instance_uuid" which isn't part of
the format string of the InstanceNotFound exception. The error looks
like this:

    Exception in string format operation
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "nova/exception.py", line 140, in __init__
        message = self.msg_fmt % kwargs
    KeyError: u'instance_id'

This patch changes the mock to use "instance_id", which is the correct
kwarg for the format string of the InstanceNotFound exception. It also
uses the correct "uuids.instance" for this mock.

Change-Id: I6745075e186ad150a8ff1765dbece267e5cc2c5b

Ml2: don't allow updating network's attribute 'segments'

This patch adds a check for update_network.

Closes-bug: #1539850

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Moved Cinder QOS tests to admin directory

Cinder QOS API is admin by default[1][2]. This patch moves the
existing Cinder/Volume QOS tests to the volume/admin directory.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/cinder/tree/etc/cinder/policy.json#n32

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-04 17:37:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/test_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/library.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/test_library.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/fakes.py'], 'message': 'NetApp: E-Series driver using invalid host-types

The NetApp E-Series driver is using a dict of hard-coded host-type
values, some of which are no longer valid. There is a list of updated
host-types that are valid, but they must be validated against what
the storage array reports as supported.

This patch removes invalid or unnecessary host-types from library.py,
and adds a verification using the host-types API to ensure that the
host-type selected by the user is valid for the storage-array.

Closes-Bug: #1555946
Change-Id: I94090eb6b2d9c7965577a462f5e70033926fa27d
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: E-Series driver using invalid host-types

The NetApp E-Series driver is using a dict of hard-coded host-type
values, some of which are no longer valid. There is a list of updated
host-types that are valid, but they must be validated against what
the storage array reports as supported.

This patch removes invalid or unnecessary host-types from library.py,
and adds a verification using the host-types API to ensure that the
host-type selected by the user is valid for the storage-array.

Closes-Bug: #1555946
Change-Id: I94090eb6b2d9c7965577a462f5e70033926fa27d

commit_message:
Excluded the 'visibility' from protected artifact fields

The visibility field was one of the proptected artifact fields (along
with 'owner', 'state' and modification timestamps) and thus it was
forbidden to explicitly set its value during the artifact creation.

Because of that it was impossible to create a public artifact draft in
a single call, while that may be required.

Also removed a redundant FIXME comment is the same code block since it
is not validRemoved some redundant FIXME comment is the same code
block since it is not valid.

Change-Id: I579405ee2b79b6018a322bb46e34acde6b5b4a4a
Closes-bug: #1585584

exception.Invalid will be raised when use task-create to import
image without properties, as task-create is a asynchronous action,
so we change task status to failure, and save the exception msg to
the task msg, the end users can get the msg when they use "task-show".

Change-Id: I08c26fd073e643d6ae7fef3475343442d24831b5
Closes-bug: #1580848
'}]
commit_message:
Raise exception when import without properties

exception.Invalid will be raised when use task-create to import
image without properties, as task-create is a asynchronous action,
so we change task status to failure, and save the exception msg to
the task msg, the end users can get the msg when they use "task-show".

Change-Id: I08c26fd073e643d6ae7fef3475343442d24831b5
Closes-bug: #1580848

commit_message:
Remove verbose option from glance tests

verbose option is going to be deleted soon (see 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206437/ for more info
why it deprecated in oslo.log) because it confuses users 
(we already have debug option). So we need to delete it from glance
tests.

Change-Id: Iade46a6097d153f2df0da73554bbfd3e2b1704f5

Change-Id: I11f057c4f15c0d0195ec2ba107e0e70473aed1bc
'}]
commit_message:
Minor revise cluster_delete engine service call

This patch revises engine service call of cluster_delete
to make it return 409 rather than 400 when cluster is
deleted without detaching all policies and disassociating
all receivers. It also revises API document accordingly.

Change-Id: I11f057c4f15c0d0195ec2ba107e0e70473aed1bc

commit_message:
filter: add more coverage for puppet logs

Puppet OpenStack CI is deploying OpenStack by using log files provided
by Ubuntu & RDO packaging, which means they don't match devstack logfile
names.

This patch aims to match OpenStack services that run in Puppet OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: Id0e347fdec78cd9636057d35c20a76fb8ae3f661

commit_message:
Finish removing legacy credentials

Change I8c24cd17f643083dde71ab2bd2a38417c54aeccb removed deprecated
legacy configured credentials, but a couple of dependencies were
overlooked. Removing them to complete the clean-up.

Note that this breaks stress for tests not marked as 'use_admin',
but since the stress test is going be depreacted, this should be
acceptable.

Change-Id: Ie814de56d588e438c375ee87e8b5994c6c364c19

commit_message:
Stop installing python-numpy for vncproxy

In the context of noVNC, numpy adds little performance according
to websockify maintainer: https://github.com/kanaka/websockify/issues/77

Change-Id: If35f10db90605ce3faa3555ac5689b631c9b51bf

commit_message:
Make compute nodes update their own inventory records

This makes the scheduler client "library" do its own inventory management.
We can't zero the legacy fields yet because we need the scheduler to
continue to work from those fields while we establish a base of the computes
doing inventory management.

Related to blueprint generic-resource-pools

Change-Id: Ibbf5e473f912755ffa794bb7d31ea09c9c6927c5

To set the stage for moving this data up, this patch removes the integrated
inventory management from the compute node object (although leaves the
routines for use later). As such, this removes the zeroing behavior of the
ComputeNode legacy resource fields as well, since we can no longer do a
join of the compute_nodes and inventory tables. Thus, we continue to
update both the legacy compute node table columns and the inventory

Change-Id: I088b90170463e686cbac49d1d934ae7969f47e6e

commit_message:
Make Inventory and ResourceProvider objects use the API DB instead

To set the stage for moving this data up, this patch removes the integrated
inventory management from the compute node object (although leaves the
routines for use later). As such, this removes the zeroing behavior of the
ComputeNode legacy resource fields as well, since we can no longer do a
join of the compute_nodes and inventory tables. Thus, we continue to
update both the legacy compute node table columns and the inventory
information in the API database.

Related to blueprint generic-resource-pools

Change-Id: I088b90170463e686cbac49d1d934ae7969f47e6e

commit_message:
Attach port to amphora when adding member to shared pool

When adding member to shared pool of load balancer(in spite of this
load balancer has listeners or not), it should plug the member port
into the amphorae if it isn't already plugged.

Change-Id: Ibe4c05fcb8a416caf931e55ab2233220b80613cb
Closes-Bug: #1572342

commit_message:
Add ability for override transformations into network_scheme.

New type of transformation 'override' was added, because hiera_hash()
function does not allow to override arrays. Arrays merged instead replace.

also fix sanitize_transformation for 'noop' transformations

Change-Id: Ic4c9c6c34d9e3a57392446b534d997666578d110
Related-bug: #1582898

commit_message:
Ignore NotFound exception in metadata_set

To avoid a race condition when updating a deleted stack, this catches the
NotFound exception specifically and ignores it.  All other exceptions are
allowed to be raised.

Closes bug: 1582236

Change-Id: I23ddb71c806c0db1ed7ed4ee4ef831ca51605d65

architecture if they wish.

Cinder is using http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware. This parses the
headers provided by the proxy, and helps us properly use TLS for

commit_message:
Enable proxy header handling for cinder

Cinder is using http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware. This parses the
headers provided by the proxy, and helps us properly use TLS for
keystone discovery. There was an option introduced in this middleware
to have it disabled by default, and this change enables it.

Change-Id: Ia33b3fa04d71eab10effd0b33eb2c194282cd15b

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2016-05-26 15:54:48.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-yum.yml', 'templates/memcached.redhat.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tasks/memcached_config.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/install-apt.yml', 'templates/memcached.debian.j2', 'tasks/memcached_install.yml', 'templates/memcached.conf.debian.j2', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'other-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

This commit updates the memcached_server role to work on Trusty,
Xenial, and CentOS 7.

NOTES:

1. This role no longer creates the memcache user since both Ubuntu and
   CentOS already install a suitable user
2. We have temporarily disabled testing of the log file since CentOS and
   Xenial do not log to file
3. On Ubuntu we drop ulimits into /etc/defaults/memcached, we need to
   figure out how to do the equivalent on CentOS
4. We update tasks/memcached_config.yml to use the correct memcached
   user in limits.conf, however neither these limits or the ones in
   templates/memcached.debian.j2 actually seem to be taking effect.
   More work in an additional review will need to be done to clean this
   all up.

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

Change-Id: I4c32f3d60939615c5d0c6fb202e96aacb35ab9b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

This commit updates the memcached_server role to work on Trusty,
Xenial, and CentOS 7.

NOTES:

1. This role no longer creates the memcache user since both Ubuntu and
   CentOS already install a suitable user
2. We have temporarily disabled testing of the log file since CentOS and
   Xenial do not log to file
3. On Ubuntu we drop ulimits into /etc/defaults/memcached, we need to
   figure out how to do the equivalent on CentOS
4. We update tasks/memcached_config.yml to use the correct memcached
   user in limits.conf, however neither these limits or the ones in
   templates/memcached.debian.j2 actually seem to be taking effect.
   More work in an additional review will need to be done to clean this
   all up.

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

commit_message:
Stable liberty py27 tests can fail

After version 3.0.0 of the swift client, it can cause the glance_store
tests to fail. This pins the version to before 3.0.0 to avoid this
problem.

Change-Id: Ib9a234a14d35951a7fd023078ac6a76736b2999e
Closes-Bug: 1583637

commit_message:
Use virtualenv isolation when building wheels

Run each round of wheel building in a fresh virtualenv. This solves
needing to have pip installed into the system python3 module search
path.

Change-Id: I7c58826e12bd5747930510af0c5c8c4134c9b815
Closes-Bug: #2000593

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-06 08:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'docker/haproxy/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Run HAProxy in a chroot jail

It's impossible to drop root for the HAProxy container.
But HAProxy provides a possibility to use a chroot jail.

When attaching to the HAProxy container, we see that
the root directory is changed:

    $ sudo docker exec -ti haproxy bash
    (haproxy)[root@operator /]# ls -di /
    259 /

Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>

Closes-Bug: #1552289

Change-Id: I9d55e9b741b8560cac53dc8b837a24a3029a4dc0
"}]
commit_message:
Run HAProxy in a chroot jail

It's impossible to drop root for the HAProxy container.
But HAProxy provides a possibility to use a chroot jail.

When attaching to the HAProxy container, we see that
the root directory is changed:

    $ sudo docker exec -ti haproxy bash
    (haproxy)[root@operator /]# ls -di /
    259 /

Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>

Closes-Bug: #1552289

Change-Id: I9d55e9b741b8560cac53dc8b837a24a3029a4dc0

commit_message:
Specify registry volume location

Makes sense specify where the docker volume path is present
for image storage in the kolla host as kolla-vagrant does in the
bootstrapping step. With this way users will know where exactly
their images are stored when re-utilize registry containers

Change-Id: I7f5c46ebab8ec4287a40cd6bd34e75eeb919a24f

Fix CinderVolumes.create_volume_and_clone

commit_message:
loadbalancer: explode hieradata to separate HAproxy & keepalived

* Stop using tripleo::loadbalancer and start using tripleo::haproxy and
  tripleo::keepalived.
* Use hieradata when possible for calling tripleo::haproxy and
  tripleo::keepalived classes.

Change-Id: I3afa4a21a22cbb574014624c6d23e17ead51ecf7
Depends-On: I84dfa9d409d390c6f549d62cb3634931e4cb432c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 19:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Enable setting None as a default value in _config_get()

This commit fixes a bug in _config_get() when trying to set a default
value of None the default path wouldn't be triggered. This fixes the
issue by switching the kwarg to use False instead of None and checking
specifically against that.

Change-Id: I3d8a881fca4d76c0f70ee2e04ea9328eb855bb46
"}]
commit_message:
Enable setting None as a default value in _config_get()

This commit fixes a bug in _config_get() when trying to set a default
value of None the default path wouldn't be triggered. This fixes the
issue by switching the kwarg to use False instead of None and checking
specifically against that.

Change-Id: I3d8a881fca4d76c0f70ee2e04ea9328eb855bb46

commit_message:
acceptance: fix ceph_rgw_civet_spec tests

In ceph_rgw_civet_spec, we used to deploy fedorapeople repo, which does
not exist anymore, since it moved to centos7. To unblock the gate, this
patch aims to update URLs & GPGkeys so it wil work again.

subject: make generate_macs.py compatible with ansible 2.1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-27 19:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['library/generate_macs.py'], 'message': 'make generate_macs.py compatible with ansible 2.1

ansible 2.1 changes the default data type assigned to module
parameters that do not declare one explicitly.  This broke the
`generate_macs.py` module because instead of receiving a complex data
structure it was now receiving strings.

Change-Id: I6c5cea5a1104b05b3f099648f33bf6bf10c1c5e1
'}]
commit_message:
make generate_macs.py compatible with ansible 2.1

ansible 2.1 changes the default data type assigned to module
parameters that do not declare one explicitly.  This broke the
`generate_macs.py` module because instead of receiving a complex data
structure it was now receiving strings.

Change-Id: I6c5cea5a1104b05b3f099648f33bf6bf10c1c5e1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8279, 'name': 'Fawad Khaliq', 'email': 'fawadkq@gmail.com', 'username': 'fawadkhaliq'}, {'_account_id': 9820, 'name': 'Liping Mao', 'email': 'limao@cisco.com', 'username': 'LipingMao'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 15361, 'name': 'Peter V. Saveliev', 'email': 'peter@svinota.eu', 'username': 'svinota'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-09 12:32:30.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/binding.py'], 'message': 'Fix pyroute2 exceptions import

With version 0.3.19 the pyroute2 module layout was changed
in a backwards incompatible way to fix a root import issue [1].
Starting with 0.3.20 all the exception classes are re-exported
from the root module.

This patch aligns the kuryr code with the new pyroute2 layout.

[1] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/228

Change-Id: Id4e04ebe38ce96c08fe307885a7918a76e5793a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pyroute2 exceptions import

With version 0.3.19 the pyroute2 module layout was changed
in a backwards incompatible way to fix a root import issue [1].
Starting with 0.3.20 all the exception classes are re-exported
from the root module.

This patch aligns the kuryr code with the new pyroute2 layout.

[1] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/228

Change-Id: Id4e04ebe38ce96c08fe307885a7918a76e5793a3

subject: [Tryfix] Increase the default RAM in vagrantfile
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1923, 'name': 'Mohammad Banikazemi', 'email': 'mbanikazemi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mb-s'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 12069, 'name': 'Taku Fukushima', 'email': 'f.tac.mac@gmail.com', 'username': 'tfukushima'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 14:07:47.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/vagrant/Vagrantfile'], 'message': '[Tryfix] Increase the default RAM in vagrantfile

When I create two containers and one tiny vm, I find the
neutron-ovs-agent is crash due to lack of memory. I know
we can add memory by modify VAGRANT_KURYR_VM_MEMORY. But
I think create two containers and one tiny vm is very
basic requirement when test kuryr, the default ram should
support this.

Change-Id: I6758ffb104d8ed91135ec58b0c2b794e7fce10c9
Closes-Bug: #1582716
'}]
commit_message:
[Tryfix] Increase the default RAM in vagrantfile

When I create two containers and one tiny vm, I find the
neutron-ovs-agent is crash due to lack of memory. I know
we can add memory by modify VAGRANT_KURYR_VM_MEMORY. But
I think create two containers and one tiny vm is very
basic requirement when test kuryr, the default ram should
support this.

Change-Id: I6758ffb104d8ed91135ec58b0c2b794e7fce10c9
Closes-Bug: #1582716

The implementation-specific config options in oslo.messaging have

commit_message:
Use transport_url config option for message queue

The implementation-specific config options in oslo.messaging have
been deprecated [1][2][3] for DEFAULT/transport_url. This removes
setting of the implementation-specific options and replaces them
with setting of DEFAULT/transport_url.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/317285
[2] https://review.openstack.org/317878
[3] https://review.openstack.org/318650

Change-Id: Ib648ed81d28fef5d6f396b14333db608b0f8b174

commit_message:
Different default value for auth_uri in docs

About the auth_uri parameter, the documentation says:

[*auth_uri*]
(optional) Specifies the public Identity URI for Mistral to use.
 Default 'http://localhost:5000/v2.0/'.
....

But the default value set is 'http://localhost:5000/'

Change-Id: I5d5c5de3019f04e11ce10f13b59d171074e2f881
Closes-Bug: #1586008

The ceph_keyring value is expected to be a full path
to the keyring. But we currently only pass in
client.<cephuser>. This patch fixes the value
to be full path.

Closes-Bug: #1586010

Change-Id: I5666c44bb35b6ae109c68506704eff776f5dceda
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph keyring setting for gnocchi

The ceph_keyring value is expected to be a full path
to the keyring. But we currently only pass in
client.<cephuser>. This patch fixes the value
to be full path.

Closes-Bug: #1586010

Change-Id: I5666c44bb35b6ae109c68506704eff776f5dceda

commit_message:
Add option id to glance_image

In glance, user can specify the desired id when creating
a new image. This can be convenient for some cases where
users want predictable ids for image, as referencing ramdisk_id
or kernel_id for AMI images.

Change-Id: I7868f2005041dea6ecd63cd601e9244cefd08e5b
(cherry picked from commit 3079b7caaebedbbe64e19c934bd54a9d29e6d0b8)

subject: Update dogpile cache with an async worker
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-25 20:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py', 'README.rst'], 'message': "Update dogpile cache with an async worker

This commit changes how we refresh our cache from doing it directly on
stale requests to do it async in the background with a worker thread.
This leverages dogpile.cache's async_creation_runner mechanism to start
a background thread when the cache goes stale that will update the cache
while still returning the cached copy in them meantime.

To enable this you need to use a dogpile.cache backend that supports
using a distributed_lock. This does not include the default dbm backend,
using a memcached based backend, like dogpile.cache.pylibmc, is
recommended for enabling this functionality.

Change-Id: I0fd29839c72ca2fdfb4c4724bb3da7e283e3d27d
"}]
commit_message:
Update dogpile cache with an async worker

This commit changes how we refresh our cache from doing it directly on
stale requests to do it async in the background with a worker thread.
This leverages dogpile.cache's async_creation_runner mechanism to start
a background thread when the cache goes stale that will update the cache
while still returning the cached copy in them meantime.

To enable this you need to use a dogpile.cache backend that supports
using a distributed_lock. This does not include the default dbm backend,
using a memcached based backend, like dogpile.cache.pylibmc, is
recommended for enabling this functionality.

Change-Id: I0fd29839c72ca2fdfb4c4724bb3da7e283e3d27d

commit_message:
Add the validation rules when create token

HTTP 500 being returned when the request body attibute for
POST /v3/auth/tokens has an empty string instead of dict.
This patch fix when the domain and the project in the scope has
an empty string.

Change-Id: I11031a5a19acb9e336721d69b59e7e6f691eb2a4
Partial-Bug: #1580338

commit_message:
Add options to set swift auth domains

We need options to be able to set the user and project domain
when using keystone v3 credentials for the swift backend. Without
these options keystone v3 swift will fail.

(cherry picked from commit 006c32a38faab5b3e16f9834a07ca5dd8ba4daf2)

subject: TLS mysql plugin support
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-27 17:13:18.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/mysql.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/mysql.py', 'docs/Plugins.md'], 'message': 'TLS mysql plugin support

New SSL optional arguments to support TLS mysql
connections.  Arguments can be passed or a
default config file can be used to pass
the connection arguments.  When host is
localhost, unix_socket is needed by the
pymysql connect call.  Host cannot be
localhost when using SSL options for
the connection.

Change-Id: Ia600a7df1923d379eec341e604cc77f7378bf3b9
'}]
commit_message:
TLS mysql plugin support

New SSL optional arguments to support TLS mysql
connections.  Arguments can be passed or a
default config file can be used to pass
the connection arguments.  When host is
localhost, unix_socket is needed by the
pymysql connect call.  Host cannot be
localhost when using SSL options for
the connection.

Change-Id: Ia600a7df1923d379eec341e604cc77f7378bf3b9

commit_message:
Downcase all hostnames for MySQL user/db creation

Mysql puppet providers apply downcase method for hostnames, that
lead us to errors when we use hostnames with upper-case letters.

Change-Id: I0da9e9aac3504d3defdfbb8b916ae7e9ae2339db
Closes-Bug: 1584247

commit_message:
[DOCS] Adding missing kernel modules for VPNaaS

Without adding the three kernel modules missing
in the network hosts, ipsec will fail because
he needs them in order to work.

With this modules it's possible to have VPNaaS
agent be working.

(cherry picked from commit 12116682146bcebce1260dda0b70cc63b5f0ce6f)

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-27 15:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/inventory/multinode', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/do_reconfigure.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/add-neutron-lbaas-dbb92dada9d34ceb.yaml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/start.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/upgrade.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/lbaas_agent.ini.j2', 'ansible/site.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/config.yml', 'kolla/common/config.py', 'ansible/inventory/all-in-one', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/deploy.yml', 'docker/neutron/neutron-lbaas-agent/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2', 'docker/neutron/neutron-lbaas-agent/extend_start.sh', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron-lbaas-agent.json.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/reconfigure.yml', 'docker/neutron/neutron-server/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/neutron/neutron-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'etc/kolla/globals.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml'], 'message': 'Adds Neutron LBaaS Support

Previously, kolla did not support neutron lbaas functionality.
Only Lbaasv2 is supported in Mitaka. Additional information can
be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/adv-config-lbaas.html
Magnum uses Neutron Lbaas to provide high availability to COE API
and Etcd endpoints within a bay. Therefore, Neutron Lbaas is required
for Kolla to support Magnum.

Co-Authored-By: Serguei Bezverkhi <sbezverk@cisco.com>
Partial-Bug: #1551992

Change-Id: I05360b7c447c601fcb3c2b6b2a913ef5cc0f3a1b
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Neutron LBaaS Support

Previously, kolla did not support neutron lbaas functionality.
Only Lbaasv2 is supported in Mitaka. Additional information can
be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/adv-config-lbaas.html
Magnum uses Neutron Lbaas to provide high availability to COE API
and Etcd endpoints within a bay. Therefore, Neutron Lbaas is required
for Kolla to support Magnum.

Co-Authored-By: Serguei Bezverkhi <sbezverk@cisco.com>
Partial-Bug: #1551992

Change-Id: I05360b7c447c601fcb3c2b6b2a913ef5cc0f3a1b

commit_message:
Resync charm helpers

Add support for OpenStack Newton and Ocata.

Rework version detection code to just match on major version for
OpenStack projects using semantic versioning.

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions
for swift packages.

Rework config-flags support helpers.

Fix is_ip function to correctly detect both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Idc2a0bc60fa75fe96ca2cb83967c5434143ad0ef

commit_message:
Correct redundancies in Scheduler Hints docs

On the Heat Stack Lifecycle Scheduler Hints page [1], there are two
occurrences of redundant language. In the first and third paragraphs it
says "...passed *to nova and cinder* by heat as scheduler hints, *to the
configured schedulers for nova and cinder*."

"to the configured schedulers for nova and cinder" is removed from both
sentences in this patch.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/developing_guides/schedulerhints.html

Change-Id: I6f525986c82f850f86a20a232b96a36ed7d622cc
Closes-Bug: #1585792

subject: Fix resource loading in resource filtering
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 11:48:24.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_resources_list.py'], 'message': 'Fix resource loading in resource filtering

We try to be careful when filtering resources from stack, to not load
all of them, but unfortunately it breaks as soon as you have
dependencies with resources that are not returned. To be on the safe
side we need to load them all and filter them afterwards.

Change-Id: I399545a6a4fd77d9707505ec9c4058d384877dec
Closes-Bug: #1585931
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resource loading in resource filtering

We try to be careful when filtering resources from stack, to not load
all of them, but unfortunately it breaks as soon as you have
dependencies with resources that are not returned. To be on the safe
side we need to load them all and filter them afterwards.

Change-Id: I399545a6a4fd77d9707505ec9c4058d384877dec
Closes-Bug: #1585931

subject: Add retry for recoverable PKCS11 errors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 16:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/exception.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/pkcs11.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_pkcs11.py'], 'message': 'Add retry for recoverable PKCS11 errors

When using the p11_crypto module with an HSM, certain errors can be thrown by
the device that currently require the Barbican application to be restarted to
recover. This CR adds to work already done to the pkcs11 module that will trap
known errors and will raise a specific exception that can be handled gracefully
without the need to restart the entire application.

In addition, the p11_crypto module has been enhanced to use a retry mechanism
when these known errors are raised after reinitializing the pkcs11 library.
This was done specifically to trap the CKR_TOKEN_NOT_PRESENT error from an HSM,
but can be enhanced further in the future to handle additional error conditions
that are recoverable with a simple reinitialization of the library to prevent
the need to restart the entire Barbican application.

Change-Id: Ic43f3729bff00560d4a344f785416546c019e016
Closes-Bug: 1582884
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry for recoverable PKCS11 errors

When using the p11_crypto module with an HSM, certain errors can be thrown by
the device that currently require the Barbican application to be restarted to
recover. This CR adds to work already done to the pkcs11 module that will trap
known errors and will raise a specific exception that can be handled gracefully
without the need to restart the entire application.

In addition, the p11_crypto module has been enhanced to use a retry mechanism
when these known errors are raised after reinitializing the pkcs11 library.
This was done specifically to trap the CKR_TOKEN_NOT_PRESENT error from an HSM,
but can be enhanced further in the future to handle additional error conditions
that are recoverable with a simple reinitialization of the library to prevent
the need to restart the entire Barbican application.

Change-Id: Ic43f3729bff00560d4a344f785416546c019e016
Closes-Bug: 1582884

subject: Load rules after service start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 10:50:41.000000000', 'files': ['congress/harness.py'], 'message': 'Load rules after service start

congress-server fails to re-start if there exists some action rules
as the rules are loaded before the engine service start. This
commit also registers the datasource service immediately after
loading the driver to avoid any errors incase polling starts
before respective service is started.

Closes-Bug:#1585563
Change-Id: I3b8046fe5d863784b426dd3f71ee46f83119d3ff
'}]
commit_message:
Load rules after service start

congress-server fails to re-start if there exists some action rules
as the rules are loaded before the engine service start. This
commit also registers the datasource service immediately after
loading the driver to avoid any errors incase polling starts
before respective service is started.

Closes-Bug:#1585563
Change-Id: I3b8046fe5d863784b426dd3f71ee46f83119d3ff

subject: install rabbitmq-server in serial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 09:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tests/test-functional.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

The tests are removed from a post_task include in the install play, and
moved to their own play as they need to be run after the entire cluster
has been formed. As well as moving a few generic vars into the
test-vars.yml include, we also pass in the specific version of rabbitmq
to be tested against in the test play.

Fixes-Bug: #1573030

Change-Id: Id119ff9f20ddfd8e1f29598c8c5ce862d2e7fab4
(cherry picked from commit 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89)
"}]
commit_message:
install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

The tests are removed from a post_task include in the install play, and
moved to their own play as they need to be run after the entire cluster
has been formed. As well as moving a few generic vars into the
test-vars.yml include, we also pass in the specific version of rabbitmq
to be tested against in the test play.

Fixes-Bug: #1573030

Change-Id: Id119ff9f20ddfd8e1f29598c8c5ce862d2e7fab4
(cherry picked from commit 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89)

commit_message:
DOCS: Configuration section - cleanup

As per discussion in the OSA docs summit session, clean up
of installation guide. This fixes typos, minor RST mark up
changes, and passive voice.

This patch also merges a some of the sections into the larger
chapter. This is in an effort to remove multiple smaller
files.

This patch is the first of many to avoid major conflicts.

Combined backport of:
 - I6801653551e79eaf74f7a9add0030d7e3688194d
   (cherry picked from commit 43ff983e4d0100ed3b101377cd205767ca9d3655)
 - Iaf3d56751dadfaf02b66ac248e01fd425b28c777
   (cherry picked from commit 2c5edcf43ee0c03251f8234b5bad667197bd9fc2)
 - I5b6d540bfa691b36dbe9cf909de8e61affb0cd92
   (cherry picked from commit e78c9e3ac2fea33008fedbed15606707e7d033cc)

Co-Authored-By: Robb Romans <robb.romans@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I5b6d540bfa691b36dbe9cf909de8e61affb0cd92

commit_message:
[WIP] Added bootprint and bootprint-swagger to project

Also adds a tools script to create HTML/CSS for each
service's migrated Swagger files.

Points to fork of bootprint-openapi to add OpenStack
header as a POC.

This requires the existence of npm on the system, which is
provided via the npm-install macro on infra.

Change-Id: Ie0f8d2305fce7233b738bc0b8f5fe2a8fb23208e

subject: Reorganize test playbooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 09:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prepare-host.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml', 'tests/test-prepare-keys.yml', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml', 'run_tests.sh', 'tests/test-prepare-containers.yml', 'tests/test-prep.yml', 'tests/group_vars/all_containers.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Reorganize test playbooks

This combines three patches which re-organise the playbooks:
 - Ie71596b028b1765083818692c7485eaed2bd88a2
   (cherry picked from commit 6806e7c9c019e8721d33cc56077d4a244e8c1613)
 - I6aa877b10945a265d7484c9aacb3c232d82d8ebb
   (cherry picked from commit 1b9035aa791164e9638c29305ee1e26cf4a3a3a2)
 - Ibc8bb7df529b28c4edf04a7efb33ea7a3f69c47f
   (cherry picked from commit d036e44e533118f98bfd7ced92c218a27347f975)

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - make run_tests.sh executable
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group vars required by containers
  - store extra variables in a single shared test-vars file
  - reduce lxc network dhcp network range to avoid conflicts with static
    container addresses
  - include callback plugin for human readable logging of test tasks
  - remove unused test-upgrade.yml

Change-Id: I6aa877b10945a265d7484c9aacb3c232d82d8ebb
(cherry picked from commit 1b9035aa791164e9638c29305ee1e26cf4a3a3a2)
"}]
commit_message:
Reorganize test playbooks

This combines three patches which re-organise the playbooks:
 - Ie71596b028b1765083818692c7485eaed2bd88a2
   (cherry picked from commit 6806e7c9c019e8721d33cc56077d4a244e8c1613)
 - I6aa877b10945a265d7484c9aacb3c232d82d8ebb
   (cherry picked from commit 1b9035aa791164e9638c29305ee1e26cf4a3a3a2)
 - Ibc8bb7df529b28c4edf04a7efb33ea7a3f69c47f
   (cherry picked from commit d036e44e533118f98bfd7ced92c218a27347f975)

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - make run_tests.sh executable
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group vars required by containers
  - store extra variables in a single shared test-vars file
  - reduce lxc network dhcp network range to avoid conflicts with static
    container addresses
  - include callback plugin for human readable logging of test tasks
  - remove unused test-upgrade.yml

Change-Id: I6aa877b10945a265d7484c9aacb3c232d82d8ebb
(cherry picked from commit 1b9035aa791164e9638c29305ee1e26cf4a3a3a2)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-24 19:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Check response from version for auth required

If the version call requires auth, we need to catch that to understand
if we should use auth for making requests.  Previously the version api
call may have been open which allowed the CLI to make the call to
determine if auth should be used. If the version call itself requires
auth, then we need to check the response code to enable authentication
for the api requests.

Change-Id: Ie70d601eb4db4909e52e6afaa15cba6195f24045
Related-Bug: #1585137
'}]
commit_message:
Check response from version for auth required

If the version call requires auth, we need to catch that to understand
if we should use auth for making requests.  Previously the version api
call may have been open which allowed the CLI to make the call to
determine if auth should be used. If the version call itself requires
auth, then we need to check the response code to enable authentication
for the api requests.

Change-Id: Ie70d601eb4db4909e52e6afaa15cba6195f24045
Related-Bug: #1585137

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I00cf4846bb933291469be94c9debed425eddf798

commit_message:
Update for convert consoles to objects

This update adds consideration for cells v2 to the
convert consoles to objects spec. It also explicitly
refers to deprecation of the consoleauth service instead
of just memcachd.

Change-Id: Icf6a328c9b391f1e28f51b935b1785c9c454f33f

commit_message:
Use public_hash for determining current protocol and address for Heat

Heat parameters heat_metadata_server_url, heat_waitcondition_server_url,
heat_watch_server_url require to be set with proper protocol and address
in case of usage SSL.

Closes-bug: #1582283

commit_message:
Cleanup Nova console proxy git repos before updating it

This fix removes /usr/share/spice-html5 and /usr/share/novnc
before updating it in order to prevent git clone issues where
simple git resets seem not clean enough.

Change-Id: I8abdffc2377b68fc40a6a9b678f24eb99a0bc537
Closes-Bug: #1585331

subject: Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7732, 'name': 'IvanBerezovskiy', 'email': 'ivan.berezovskii@gmail.com', 'username': 'iberezovskiy'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 18795, 'name': 'mkarpin', 'email': 'mkarpin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkarpin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-26 16:11:22.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add_transport_url_parameters-648f7e1e691eabe5.yaml', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/aodh_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The url is
of the form:

  transport::/user:pass@host:port/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend as one of
rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the host, port and
auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get these options via the
transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use olso::messaging::notifications resource
* add new parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests for added parameters
* add feature release not

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If9e028cbcd0db4b8e472cbcd11407807f2a8c198
'}]
commit_message:
Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The url is
of the form:

  transport::/user:pass@host:port/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend as one of
rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the host, port and
auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get these options via the
transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use olso::messaging::notifications resource
* add new parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests for added parameters
* add feature release not

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If9e028cbcd0db4b8e472cbcd11407807f2a8c198

subject: lxc_cache_resolvers [u'nameserver1',u'nameserver2'] fixing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 11:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': "lxc_cache_resolvers [u'nameserver1',u'nameserver2'] fixing

When running bootstrap-aio.sh twice with latest ansible runs OR when
providing your own resolvers from inside a unicode file, the
lxc_cache_resolvers will be generated as this:
lxc_cache_resolvers: [u'nameserver1',u'nameserver2']

This commit fixes this behaviour, and allow provided lxc_cache_resolvers
into CLI, from a file, or generated from hosts (when not set).

Change-Id: I6cb34e1a922d374ddccc37fd7bf0fd5ff9e14b88
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
"}]
commit_message:
lxc_cache_resolvers [u'nameserver1',u'nameserver2'] fixing

When running bootstrap-aio.sh twice with latest ansible runs OR when
providing your own resolvers from inside a unicode file, the
lxc_cache_resolvers will be generated as this:
lxc_cache_resolvers: [u'nameserver1',u'nameserver2']

This commit fixes this behaviour, and allow provided lxc_cache_resolvers
into CLI, from a file, or generated from hosts (when not set).

Change-Id: I6cb34e1a922d374ddccc37fd7bf0fd5ff9e14b88
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
ovo: Make modify_fields_(from|to)_db instance methods

Now we expose those modify_fields methods as instance methods however
we preserve internal classmethods for mangling with field names.

Partial-Bug: 1541928

commit_message:
Use C vairant of YAML dumper at tasks serialization

To speed up seiralization time, use faster implementation of
YAML dumping when it is possible.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 09:32:50.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/network/ip.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/exceptions.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/fetch/__init__.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py'], 'message': 'Resync charm helpers

change to is_ip which correctly detects both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses,
resolving problems when Juju presents an IPv6 based private-address

commit_message:
Resync charm helpers

This brings in a few changes, but specifically of interest is the
change to is_ip which correctly detects both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses,
resolving problems when Juju presents an IPv6 based private-address
back to the charm.

Change-Id: I3b6391053db83c8b3f1662f010783703b1f16d0a
Closes-Bug: 1574844

subject: Resync charm helpers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 11:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/network/ip.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/exceptions.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/fetch/__init__.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py'], 'message': 'Resync charm helpers

Add support for OpenStack Newton and Ocata.

Rework version detection code to just match on major version for
OpenStack projects using semantic versioning.

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions
for swift packages.

Rework config-flags support helpers.

Fix is_ip function to correctly detect both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Ib8ba1c709494c844b61a0654956bbd41b875d986
'}]
commit_message:
Resync charm helpers

Add support for OpenStack Newton and Ocata.

Rework version detection code to just match on major version for
OpenStack projects using semantic versioning.

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions
for swift packages.

Rework config-flags support helpers.

Fix is_ip function to correctly detect both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Ib8ba1c709494c844b61a0654956bbd41b875d986

commit_message:
DOCS: Configuration section - cleanup

As per discussion in the OSA docs summit session, clean up
of installation guide. This fixes typos, minor RST mark up
changes, and passive voice.

This patch also merges a some of the sections into the larger
chapter. This is in an effort to remove multiple smaller
files.

This patch is the first of many to avoid major conflicts.

commit_message:
Move _acl_remote_match_ip to common/acl

This patch moves _acl_remote_match_ip to common/acl in order to
move all the acl code out of the ml2 driver and to enable us to
remove the duplicated code from the ovn_core plugin until its removed
so the same acl code is used between the two plugins.

Change-Id: Ic6de8a89898f5684f19489274f79f15bc9f574d9

commit_message:
Move _get_sg_ports_from_cache to common/acl

This patch moves _get_sg_ports_from_cache to common/acl in order to
move all the acl code out of the ml2 driver and to enable us to
remove the duplicated code from the ovn_core plugin until its removed
so the same acl code is used between the two plugins.

Change-Id: Ie570e3866ad2a48d29c79a1fd877dd1911f759c9

subject: Clarify the confusing warning in case of Keystone v2.0 vs v3 conflict

commit_message:
Clarify the confusing warning in case of Keystone v2.0 vs v3 conflict

Since the function emitting the warning now can be used both for
processing of Keystone URL from Horizon settings and for fixing
URLs from service catalog, the old warning messages becomes confusing.
The patch makes things clear again.

Change-Id: Id70b50e01fc9c3d59d5e41684759b5c8bd8abee9

commit_message:
Dynamic Reconfiguration

Currently, Cinder services have to be restarted when a change is made
to configuration options in cinder.conf in order to pick up the
modifications. There is no option nor capability of having these
changes picked up automatically when the file is modified.

Change-Id: I90b241859917165929189e8fdd6ea36487831c66
Implements: blueprint dynamic-reconfiguration

commit_message:
Fix "single_alias" action for CLI commands

For the moment if default value for CLI option with
"single_alias" action is different than None we cannot redefine it.
Fix it and cover with unit tests.

Also, fix existing aliases and add some where good to have.

Change-Id: Ic61426d9bd894b01f9b035d6d19bb7bd113f96ad
Closes-Bug: #1552771

commit_message:
Resync charm helpers

Add support for OpenStack Newton and Ocata.

Rework version detection code to just match on major version for
OpenStack projects using semantic versioning.

Provide fallback version detection based on major.minor versions
for swift packages.

Rework config-flags support helpers.

Fix is_ip function to correctly detect both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Ifed0c7a742291bbc6380143be0f8b743c5b918f3

subject: Add a check for hosts particular kernel modules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 19:42:36.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/openstack_kernel_modules.yml'], 'message': 'Add a check for hosts particular kernel modules

Some hosts needs to have more specific kernel
modules loaded in memory. Based on a list of
those modules and their target group hosts, this
patch checks how these modules are implemented
in the kernel by searching for a specified pattern
for each module in /boot/config-$kernel_version,
loads them if they are dynamic and fails in case
they are not set in the kernel configuration.

Note: This is a manual cherry-pick of
I728f36146bd99193b346ebf4158d3716f0fbbed8 from master

Change-Id: I728f36146bd99193b346ebf4158d3716f0fbbed8
Closes-Bug: 1546818
'}]
commit_message:
Add a check for hosts particular kernel modules

Some hosts needs to have more specific kernel
modules loaded in memory. Based on a list of
those modules and their target group hosts, this
patch checks how these modules are implemented
in the kernel by searching for a specified pattern
for each module in /boot/config-$kernel_version,
loads them if they are dynamic and fails in case
they are not set in the kernel configuration.

Note: This is a manual cherry-pick of
I728f36146bd99193b346ebf4158d3716f0fbbed8 from master

Change-Id: I728f36146bd99193b346ebf4158d3716f0fbbed8
Closes-Bug: 1546818

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-26 21:05:30.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/xenapi-independent-nova.rst'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Support Nova services independently from the hypervisor

The ability to run Nova compute services independently from the
XenServer host which is running the virtual machines would enable more
flexible deployment and development models, and would significantly
lower the barrier to entry for XenAPI developers.

This spec makes the necessary changes to enable this independent mode
of deployment, where the Nova compute services could be running on an
entirely different machine

Change-Id: Ibb793ca029173de5c720e10eb3d016d7ffbaf264
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Support Nova services independently from the hypervisor

The ability to run Nova compute services independently from the
XenServer host which is running the virtual machines would enable more
flexible deployment and development models, and would significantly
lower the barrier to entry for XenAPI developers.

This spec makes the necessary changes to enable this independent mode
of deployment, where the Nova compute services could be running on an
entirely different machine

Change-Id: Ibb793ca029173de5c720e10eb3d016d7ffbaf264

commit_message:
Retire openstack-ansible-py_from_git repository

The content from the openstack-ansible-py_from_git repository
is no longer needed.

This patch implements the retirement of the py_from_git
repository from gate testing as per [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Depends-On: I1af414d5f1f2290e7bfebb3153ef829c87f0c3f0

commit_message:
Remove custom SSL-related resource for cinder

Now that cinder includes http_proxy_to_wsgi by default[1] our puppet
resource that included it in cinder's api-paste config is not longer
needed.

[1] If5aab9cc25a2e7c66a0bb13b5f7488a667b30309

Change-Id: I6141b6caf9b04ee73fae3ae2b94b3001b21b9999

Currently build-rpm.sh doesn't respect externally
defined EXTRAREPO variable.

This patchset adds ability to pass additional EXTRAREPO
by environment variables.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 12:50:36.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py', 'config.yaml', 'hooks/charmhelpers/fetch/__init__.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add defaults for openstack-origin-git config option

openstack-origin-git currently only supports YAML that specifies
the git repositories to deploy from.

This adds support for default openstack-origin-git values. The
default values supported are: icehouse, kilo, liberty, mitaka,
and master.  For example: openstack-origin-git=master.

Change-Id: If2853f026407d7d5d63e03a006dd67c53fb431fc
'}]
commit_message:
Add defaults for openstack-origin-git config option

openstack-origin-git currently only supports YAML that specifies
the git repositories to deploy from.

This adds support for default openstack-origin-git values. The
default values supported are: icehouse, kilo, liberty, mitaka,
and master.  For example: openstack-origin-git=master.

Change-Id: If2853f026407d7d5d63e03a006dd67c53fb431fc

subject: Ensure that modified files are kept when installing/upgrading
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 15:43:22.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that modified files are kept when installing/upgrading

In a situation where the LXC cache and the apt mirror used do
not have matching package versions, or where the host and the
LXC cache have mismatches, the 'apt-get upgrade' and/or
'apt-get install' actions can fail due to dpkg asking what to
do about the config file mismatches.

This patch ensures that dpkg knows what to do, which is to
keep the existing in-place file (the file copied from the
host). This ensures that whatever apt configuration was
implemented on the host is definitely used in the containers.

Change-Id: I1f8bc785a8acdac71f46eff0e0d9573ba5c62ab3
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that modified files are kept when installing/upgrading

In a situation where the LXC cache and the apt mirror used do
not have matching package versions, or where the host and the
LXC cache have mismatches, the 'apt-get upgrade' and/or
'apt-get install' actions can fail due to dpkg asking what to
do about the config file mismatches.

This patch ensures that dpkg knows what to do, which is to
keep the existing in-place file (the file copied from the
host). This ensures that whatever apt configuration was
implemented on the host is definitely used in the containers.

Change-Id: I1f8bc785a8acdac71f46eff0e0d9573ba5c62ab3

subject: Fixes race condition in HeatStack
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-22 14:21:03.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/heat_stack.py'], 'message': 'Fixes race condition in HeatStack

Before each operation HeatStack waits for the stack to become available.
But if several operations happen concurrently it might be the case when
several threads both check stack availability and conclude its ready and
then both try to update it. In this case Heat client throws HTTPConflict
exception. This fix handles it and retries the operation after delay.

Change-Id: Ibff461ed606e7fb1fc76ad422b4431476e22ab0b
Closes-Bug: #1571863
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition in HeatStack

Before each operation HeatStack waits for the stack to become available.
But if several operations happen concurrently it might be the case when
several threads both check stack availability and conclude its ready and
then both try to update it. In this case Heat client throws HTTPConflict
exception. This fix handles it and retries the operation after delay.

Change-Id: Ibff461ed606e7fb1fc76ad422b4431476e22ab0b
Closes-Bug: #1571863

subject: Allow Storm 1.0.x to be used as well as 0.9.x
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 15:20:44.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/mon.py'], 'message': 'Allow Storm 1.0.x to be used as well as 0.9.x

In 1.0.x, the class name start with org.apache instead of backtype.
So, I removed the backtype part so either class names that start
org.apache or backtype will be found.

To ensure it only find real storm processes, I also changed it to
look for storm.daemon.supervisor and storm.daemon.nimbus on the initial
check

Change-Id: I367dd319b77979c44ccc0acd89503aabc3ec114b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Storm 1.0.x to be used as well as 0.9.x

In 1.0.x, the class name start with org.apache instead of backtype.
So, I removed the backtype part so either class names that start
org.apache or backtype will be found.

To ensure it only find real storm processes, I also changed it to
look for storm.daemon.supervisor and storm.daemon.nimbus on the initial
check

Change-Id: I367dd319b77979c44ccc0acd89503aabc3ec114b

subject: Ensure collector exits promptly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 18:51:08.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/daemon.py'], 'message': 'Ensure collector exits promptly

Exits the collector even if threads are still running checks.
The supervisor will always kill the process after a few seconds,
but this can disrupt service restarts since the init.d script only
sleeps for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ia13ac951ba2a06f810c6dde5499b9b7552e2f3ad
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure collector exits promptly

Exits the collector even if threads are still running checks.
The supervisor will always kill the process after a few seconds,
but this can disrupt service restarts since the init.d script only
sleeps for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ia13ac951ba2a06f810c6dde5499b9b7552e2f3ad

commit_message:
Add new parameter 'security_ntp_bind_local_interfaces_only'

With the parameter 'security_ntp_bind_local_interfaces_only' it is possible
to configure if chronyd should listen on all available network interfaces for
NTP requests.

Change-Id: I7e56d60df7c7214e753d1ca86aceed05849addef

commit_message:
skip test_create_delete_alarm_with_combination_rule

Combination alarms was deprecated by [1]. Since this patch, the Tempest
test that used to test this feature does not work anymore out of the
box, you need to set enable_combination_alarms to True, which is a
deprecated parameter, not sure deployers want to use it, since it aims
to be removed in a future release.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/aodh/commit/20abf3b1fb0190aa7c777f01844d062682ea41e1

Related-Bug: #1585267
Change-Id: I4250b7d215cff38b7f1b0db0f0ba1ea303cc2133

subject: Do not archive root directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 20:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/centos_log_settings.yml'], 'message': 'Do not archive root directory

DIB is putting image cache in the root directory for the image
building jobs, which then gets uploaded to the artifacts server
for every job. That is 1.5GB of images getting put on the artifacts
server for every job that builds images. Since there is not anything
useful in the root directory anyways it is easiest to just not
archive it.

Change-Id: I4e2f05fbce4ae6dc59e07b828e35edad5f9aafe2
'}]
commit_message:
Do not archive root directory

DIB is putting image cache in the root directory for the image
building jobs, which then gets uploaded to the artifacts server
for every job. That is 1.5GB of images getting put on the artifacts
server for every job that builds images. Since there is not anything
useful in the root directory anyways it is easiest to just not
archive it.

Change-Id: I4e2f05fbce4ae6dc59e07b828e35edad5f9aafe2

revisions:

Previously every description was shown fully and it caused troubles

Change-Id: I3bb64382b48d1435dea20bccea96836d3d2015da
Closes-Bug: #1465315
'}]
commit_message:
Hide extra text in descriptions and allow expanding

Previously every description was shown fully and it caused troubles
in case of large descriptions.

For now every description is covered in div tag. js-handler provides
code to create and control links to expand and compress these fields.

Change-Id: I3bb64382b48d1435dea20bccea96836d3d2015da
Closes-Bug: #1465315

commit_message:
Add test with detached haproxy role

- Add test with external load balancer. Controllers are
from different racks and haproxy is from rack-3
- Separate devops config with appropriate networks
assigned to nodes is used
- Local repos for cluster are used because public networks
are routed without internet connection
- OSTF isn't running because it's not implied to use
separate haproxy

Closes-Bug: #1583530

Change-Id: I0d3647c8eb13159c27e64ddf5925467f451b610c
(cherry picked from commit 7a5970fa64bff6c86b35bf65bcd7222eef7c04c4)

commit_message:
Added cold VM migration support

Cold migration enables migrating some of the VMs which are not in active state (e.g. stopped). Cold migration can also be used for migrating active VM, although VM is shut down and hence unaccessible while migrating.

Change-Id: I89ad0a04d41282431c9773f6ae7feb41573368e3
Closes-Bug: #1564297

  deployment_info if "isolated". After that

  But nailgun will NOT apply any new settings
  if replaced_deployment_info exists for node.

  Closes-bug: 1572240

(cherry picked from commit 62f75c10445a3cd275c86dae8028e8f444ef1968)

Change-Id: I244e9da3c6f9f28da49964dcda1bd619f9912ced
'}]
commit_message:
Apply network templates before preupgrade handler

  Controller's "preupgrade" handler replaces
  deployment_info if "isolated". After that
  Octane applies network template.

  But nailgun will NOT apply any new settings
  if replaced_deployment_info exists for node.

  Closes-bug: 1572240

(cherry picked from commit 62f75c10445a3cd275c86dae8028e8f444ef1968)

Change-Id: I244e9da3c6f9f28da49964dcda1bd619f9912ced

to enable client-side internal web browser protection mechanisms.

Change-Id: Idc60877c84f4b07617eaee0450fde4910e03f2e2

commit_message:
Hardening Nginx configuration

This commit contains some tweaks for the Nginx to prevent several
types of attacks, now we send to the client several HTTP headers
to enable client-side internal web browser protection mechanisms.
Also, we allow only required request methods for each service
provided by the server.

Change-Id: Idc60877c84f4b07617eaee0450fde4910e03f2e2
Closes-Bug: #1585203
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

This patch combines I031872f5a9e9f0e2d076eb709f4e9ca2a41a5b60 and
I874726808f975cdea30459ef525cff0d00a5468c

Since Mitaka Nova v2.0 endpoint is deprecated and now switched to v2.1.
Nova (v2) endpoint was not removed from Nova at all, but was renamed to
nova_legacy. And we still want to have nova legacy endpoint (v2) in Fuel.

Change-Id: I031872f5a9e9f0e2d076eb709f4e9ca2a41a5b60
Closes-bug: #1581459

commit_message:
Update Nova endpoints

This patch combines I031872f5a9e9f0e2d076eb709f4e9ca2a41a5b60 and
I874726808f975cdea30459ef525cff0d00a5468c

Since Mitaka Nova v2.0 endpoint is deprecated and now switched to v2.1.
Nova (v2) endpoint was not removed from Nova at all, but was renamed to
nova_legacy. And we still want to have nova legacy endpoint (v2) in Fuel.

Change-Id: I031872f5a9e9f0e2d076eb709f4e9ca2a41a5b60
Closes-bug: #1581459

commit_message:
Enable SSL request handling from HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware

This is a backport from master, we cannot use
enable_proxy_headers_parsing option because
there is no puppet-oslo module in stable-mitaka

Related-Bug: #1576740

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 10:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['doc/base_tests.rst', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_unlock_settings_tab.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/cluster_configs.yaml', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/utils.py'], 'message': "Add Unlock settings tab test

This patch implements tests for Unlock Settings
Tab Feature with randomly changed settings.

Scenario:
    1. Load clusters' configurations from the file
    2. Revert snapshot with appropriate nodes count
    3. Create a cluster from config
    4. Update nodes accordingly to the config
    5. Deploy the cluster
    6. Get cluster attributes
    7. Modify randomly cluster attributes
    8. Add if it's needed ceph nodes
    9. Update cluster attributes with changed one
    10. Redeploy cluster
    11. Run OSTF
    12. Go to the next config

Duration xxx m
Snapshot will be maked for all failed configurations

Change-Id: I3376dc29cf8083ead742384725e3e0a10dae2b34
(cherry picked from commit 8d6186acd3d02cec3415697fa1844c3a8bec4061)
"}]
commit_message:
Add Unlock settings tab test

This patch implements tests for Unlock Settings
Tab Feature with randomly changed settings.

Scenario:
    1. Load clusters' configurations from the file
    2. Revert snapshot with appropriate nodes count
    3. Create a cluster from config
    4. Update nodes accordingly to the config
    5. Deploy the cluster
    6. Get cluster attributes
    7. Modify randomly cluster attributes
    8. Add if it's needed ceph nodes
    9. Update cluster attributes with changed one
    10. Redeploy cluster
    11. Run OSTF
    12. Go to the next config

Duration xxx m
Snapshot will be maked for all failed configurations

Change-Id: I3376dc29cf8083ead742384725e3e0a10dae2b34
(cherry picked from commit 8d6186acd3d02cec3415697fa1844c3a8bec4061)

subject: Add Ops repo to OpenStack-Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 17:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add Ops repo to OpenStack-Ansible

At the Austin summit it was agreed that OpenStack-Ansible should
have a repository to facilitate the sharing of various scripts/tips
which may be useful to operators or developers when using
OpenStack-Ansible.

This patch creates the repository for the project and sets up the
basic jobs for it.

Needed-By: Ib6cd1afcdee502a0819c1afb7b27f27f8f96b381
Change-Id: I96a582d73871c9f479619e5492764919c424e7a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add Ops repo to OpenStack-Ansible

At the Austin summit it was agreed that OpenStack-Ansible should
have a repository to facilitate the sharing of various scripts/tips
which may be useful to operators or developers when using
OpenStack-Ansible.

This patch creates the repository for the project and sets up the
basic jobs for it.

Needed-By: Ib6cd1afcdee502a0819c1afb7b27f27f8f96b381
Change-Id: I96a582d73871c9f479619e5492764919c424e7a1

commit_message:
Add overcloud VIP to sshuttle config

Overcloud VIP in overcloudrs is 10.0.0.4/32, and should be
included in sshuttle forwarding, keystone listens on this
IP address only.

Change-Id: I5d0e9e24ee2d858997929b8e659adced7a4f7482

subject: VMware: Enable memory, disk and vnic limits
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-27 00:50:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/vmware-limits.rst'], 'message': 'VMware: Enable memory, disk and vnic limits

Re-proposing this spec from mitaka to complete
the implementation for blueprint vmware-limits-newton.

Pending items:
- configure vif limits when attaching interfaces
- configure limits during resize operation
- expose the limits configuration parameters via image metadata

Change-Id: Ice28f0122bf5b2640fec622121156af3a6fdf88e
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Enable memory, disk and vnic limits

Re-proposing this spec from mitaka to complete
the implementation for blueprint vmware-limits-newton.

Pending items:
- configure vif limits when attaching interfaces
- configure limits during resize operation
- expose the limits configuration parameters via image metadata

Change-Id: Ice28f0122bf5b2640fec622121156af3a6fdf88e

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 11:21:31.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Ensure ryu and ovs are compatible

As ryu>=4.1 depends on ovs>=2.6.0.dev0, update the ovs package
constraints. In particular, on python2.7 we need to allow ovs 2.6.0 to

'}]
commit_message:
Ensure ryu and ovs are compatible

As ryu>=4.1 depends on ovs>=2.6.0.dev0, update the ovs package
constraints. In particular, on python2.7 we need to allow ovs 2.6.0 to
be installed.

Closes-Bug: 1584858

Change-Id: I6d2796a1aba3e0a299291946b4c9c4169fa00923

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-05-27 00:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'Puppetfile', 'all-in-one.sh', 'fixtures/scenario001.pp', 'manifests/repos.pp', 'external_modules.txt', 'fixtures/scenario002.pp', 'fixtures/scenario003.pp'], 'message': 'Support of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Xenial deployments

Add support for Xenial deployments.

* Disable SSL on Ubuntu Xenial deployments.
* Pin puppetlabs-mysql to a recent commit (until they produce a new
  tag).
* Disable Ceph on Ubuntu Xenial deployments, neither Hammer or Jewel currently
  work out of the box with puppet-ceph on Xenial.
* Disable Horizon on Ubuntu Xenial deployments: not working yet.
* Do not deploy UCA on Xenial, since we currently deploy Mitaka.
* On Xenial, deploy Puppet using distro packaging, not puppetlabs.com.
* Cleanup /etc/default/puppet on Xenial / Puppet4 runs (workaround)
  until we figure what is installing this file on Xenial nodepool
  image.

All issues are documented here:
See https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/puppet-openstack-xenial

Change-Id: Ifc8c7e241add830c88b84c1f01770e5e15df1653
'}]
commit_message:
Support of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Xenial deployments

Add support for Xenial deployments.

* Disable SSL on Ubuntu Xenial deployments.
* Pin puppetlabs-mysql to a recent commit (until they produce a new
  tag).
* Disable Ceph on Ubuntu Xenial deployments, neither Hammer or Jewel currently
  work out of the box with puppet-ceph on Xenial.
* Disable Horizon on Ubuntu Xenial deployments: not working yet.
* Do not deploy UCA on Xenial, since we currently deploy Mitaka.
* On Xenial, deploy Puppet using distro packaging, not puppetlabs.com.
* Cleanup /etc/default/puppet on Xenial / Puppet4 runs (workaround)
  until we figure what is installing this file on Xenial nodepool
  image.

All issues are documented here:
See https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/puppet-openstack-xenial

Change-Id: Ifc8c7e241add830c88b84c1f01770e5e15df1653

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 18:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Completed migrations are not "in progress"

This fixes an issue where we consider migrations that have been completed
as "in progress" by not filtering them out of the result set from
migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node(). This adds that state to
the list and adds a migration in that state to the test case. If it
is not filtered, the counts won't line up and the test will fail.

Change-Id: I7aafab9abdbfafe9479846f06068ba8a963d290a
Closes-Bug: #1583720
'}]
commit_message:
Completed migrations are not "in progress"

This fixes an issue where we consider migrations that have been completed
as "in progress" by not filtering them out of the result set from
migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node(). This adds that state to
the list and adds a migration in that state to the test case. If it
is not filtered, the counts won't line up and the test will fail.

Change-Id: I7aafab9abdbfafe9479846f06068ba8a963d290a
Closes-Bug: #1583720

Fix action stop to consider MySQL not running if only there is no
SST and no pid found.
Fix proc_stop command to match mysqld by its datadir, fix its stop
retry count and wait timeout

I73fa1db5210f02d6df9dc324f8b4ec21232d06ba relating to apt conf files.

Change-Id: I56f7c8520cc6cec74df5ca8611d988039184efbb
'}]
commit_message:
Set AIO to use an OpenStack-Infra wheel mirror

To speed up an AIO build when *not* executed in the OpenStack-CI gate,
this patch determines the fastest available wheel mirror and includes
it as an extra pip index.

This speeds up the repo build process by ensuring that the wheels do
not need to be built locally, but can simply be downloaded from the
mirror.

The patch also includes some clean up which was left out of
I73fa1db5210f02d6df9dc324f8b4ec21232d06ba relating to apt conf files.

Change-Id: I56f7c8520cc6cec74df5ca8611d988039184efbb

Purge nova services for deleted nodes

Deleted hosts create downed services in nova, which should
be cleaned up on the next deploy cycle.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 16:41:49.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/objects/partition/parted.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_partition.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/partition.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_partition_utils.py'], 'message': "Add option to choose partition alignment mode

Under certain circumstances due to that alignment, the end of
particular partition could cross 1M boundary. And due to actual
partition' bounderies being rounded up, fuel-agent mistakenly
assumes that partition couldn't fit within provided boundaries
and raises errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError.

However, some h/w data storages are well known for reporting
relatively huge optimal IO sizes (16M or even bigger), so the 1M
room can't be enough. Thus, optimal aligning is not an option.
In such cases, it's better to proceed with minimal mode.

It's the minimum aligment needed to align the partition properly
to physical blocks which avoids performance degradation.

Partial-Bug: #1543233
DocImpact

Change-Id: I1dd94731f497f3deb47cec9a23957e3706c2fb3b
(cherry picked from commit af247ea07a469c467b83687013a68b0e3cff05fe)
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to choose partition alignment mode

Under certain circumstances due to that alignment, the end of
particular partition could cross 1M boundary. And due to actual
partition' bounderies being rounded up, fuel-agent mistakenly
assumes that partition couldn't fit within provided boundaries
and raises errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError.

However, some h/w data storages are well known for reporting
relatively huge optimal IO sizes (16M or even bigger), so the 1M
room can't be enough. Thus, optimal aligning is not an option.
In such cases, it's better to proceed with minimal mode.

It's the minimum aligment needed to align the partition properly
to physical blocks which avoids performance degradation.

Partial-Bug: #1543233
DocImpact

Change-Id: I1dd94731f497f3deb47cec9a23957e3706c2fb3b
(cherry picked from commit af247ea07a469c467b83687013a68b0e3cff05fe)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 09:41:27.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/drivers/nailgun.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_nailgun.py'], 'message': "Enable unallocated drives back

Apparently fix for this bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1258347
turned out to be non-working anyway.
The reason was that 'lvm_meta_pool' sometimes has non-zero size.
Due to its non-zero size the disk wasn't skipped from partitioning,
thus creating a bunch of partitions even on unallocated drives.

Change-Id: Ifaf8cb6a1f9d5010998b89445c3e575f3957411b
Closes-Bug: #1566399
(cherry picked from commit 825468cb3bb1eb1e6a5e7cd665d89496998cdb54)
