commit_message:
Enable unallocated drives back

Apparently fix for this bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1258347
turned out to be non-working anyway.
The reason was that 'lvm_meta_pool' sometimes has non-zero size.
Due to its non-zero size the disk wasn't skipped from partitioning,
thus creating a bunch of partitions even on unallocated drives.

Change-Id: Ifaf8cb6a1f9d5010998b89445c3e575f3957411b
Closes-Bug: #1566399
(cherry picked from commit 825468cb3bb1eb1e6a5e7cd665d89496998cdb54)
(cherry picked from commit 6e89fb83e44a7cd3b286308b661f645378576d19)

commit_message:
Add enable-release command

This command enables to deploy an older release of OpenStack
with the upgraded Fuel Master node. Release to enable is
identified by the ID. Administrator's password is required
to access the Fuel API.

Example:

  octane enable-release --id 1 --admin-password admin

Partial-bug: 1567535
Change-Id: I625db20e570b177cb46143818ac65c5d78cda0e2
(cherry picked from commit f73e0c7a9942c2fe211a82dd19107e9fa351e0bd)

commit_message:
Add Non-voting job for nodepool py34

Add py34 non-voting job for nodepool. With python3 fixes being
proposed to nodepool, it is important that there is at least
minimal reporting on success/failure of the py34 checking. As
soon as the test suite can run this can be converted to a voting
job.

Change-Id: I4fc17b67338eb3f36b550fa9f519d439c0d37022

subject: [WIP] Hyper-V: fix serial console workers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 12:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Hyper-V: fix serial console workers

At the moment, we spawn a worker retrieving instance serial
console output when the instance start event is received AND when
the driver receives a power on/reboot request for the instance,
basically attempting to spawn a worker twice.

Although the method which starts the workers is synchronized,
checking if a worker is already running, it keeps a dict of workers
per VMOps instance object.

This change fixes the issue by starting workers only when an instance
power on event in received. Also, workers are now safely stopped.

Change-Id: Ie0c54c2a5e2f90b80792522bf9eabbf07476e1b5
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Hyper-V: fix serial console workers

At the moment, we spawn a worker retrieving instance serial
console output when the instance start event is received AND when
the driver receives a power on/reboot request for the instance,
basically attempting to spawn a worker twice.

Although the method which starts the workers is synchronized,
checking if a worker is already running, it keeps a dict of workers
per VMOps instance object.

This change fixes the issue by starting workers only when an instance
power on event in received. Also, workers are now safely stopped.

Change-Id: Ie0c54c2a5e2f90b80792522bf9eabbf07476e1b5

commit_message:
Xenapi: support vgpu via passthrough pci

the implment is to support VGPU via passthrough pci. In order to
support it, it will create fake pci devices for the VGPUs at
Xenapi.

Refactor get_filtered_hosts in filter host manager

* Removed nested loop in filter algorithm; O(kn) becomes O(k+n)

feature by disconnecting the dm-crypt device, which provides
access to unencrypted disk, when an encrypted instance is

commit_message:
libvirt: Disconnect dm-crypt on instance suspend/stop

Strengthens protection provided by ephemeral storage encryption
feature by disconnecting the dm-crypt device, which provides
access to unencrypted disk, when an encrypted instance is
suspended or stopped.

Co-Authored-By: Joel Coffman <joel.coffman@jhuapl.edu>

Implements: blueprint stop-dmcrypt-on-suspend
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Idbe37922c5f944e3d567ce16913ce5d87af41fef

Currently "nova-manage vm list" command is displaying the list of all
vms irrespective of vm_state(active,error..).
As suggested in bug, Added CLI support for new parameter "status" to
filter the VMs based on vm_state in db. If status is not provided,

Closes-Bug: #1494841
'}]
commit_message:
Support for new --status parameter to "nova-manage vm list" command

Currently "nova-manage vm list" command is displaying the list of all
vms irrespective of vm_state(active,error..).
As suggested in bug, Added CLI support for new parameter "status" to
filter the VMs based on vm_state in db. If status is not provided,
all vms(active,error..) will be displayed.

Change-Id: I6ebc3ddd4d8c5506684122bcbc12bec551a9cb83
Closes-Bug: #1494841

commit_message:
libvirt: Nova part of volume snapshot improvements

This patch implements blueprint volume-snapshot-improvements :
  * Add new file format querying and reporting to libvirt snapshot code
  * Add code to ensure compatibility with pre-liberty Cinder
  * Add testcases

Testing Info:
  1) Related patch: Ifa2836a87271d465af61c4ae4b2018cde0698924
  2) Tested with Cinder (with above Change-Id) configured against
     GlusterFS backend

Implements: blueprint volume-snapshot-improvements
Change-Id: Ib5c3de6e757a8cdd098d68ca26194891458b57a9

commit_message:
libvirt: Refactor _volume_snapshot_delete function

This patch refactors _volume_snapshot_delete function. It splits
it up into different helper functions such that its easier to
debug, read and maintain the volume snapshot delete flow.

Change-Id: I525dc6f8df236f66b9d81c1510a8822214335526

commit_message:
objects: Add support for OnlineSnapshotInfo object

This patch adds support for OnlineSnapshotInfo object, which provides
the ability to :

  * Add new statuses for progress reporting to libvirt snapshot create/delete
     operations
  * For liberty, continue to send the 'progress': '90%' flag in
     update_snapshot_status

Partially Implements: blueprint volume-snapshot-improvements
Change-Id: Ic0215d5e18fb74ac36fd7b08f8a27ca991e7ebdb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-11 08:03:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Nova handles servers list with limit=0 different in API and DB

According to the code:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/common.py#n206

when limit = 0, it should apply as max_limit, but currently, in:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n1930

Change-Id: I42034dbf54a91caafaa313000e825f64c618d2b8

commit_message:
Nova handles servers list with limit=0 different in API and DB

According to the code:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/common.py#n206

when limit = 0, it should apply as max_limit, but currently, in:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n1930

we directly return [], this is quite different with comment in the api
code.

Change-Id: I42034dbf54a91caafaa313000e825f64c618d2b8

commit_message:
libvirt: refactor config drive live migration test

The code in pre_live_migration() to check whether live migration with
config drive is supported in various cases is complex enough and
heavily enough commented that moving it to a separate function helps
make the code more straightforward to follow.

Also, if we do this, we can create separate tests for the new function
allowing us to test this logic in isolation rather than having to probe
each condition in the context of a full call to pre_live_migration().

Change-Id: I444c596efdf926c62b64fdfddaee4791ad267434
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-08-25 02:21:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/pci/test_whitelist.py', 'nova/pci/whitelist.py'], 'message': 'Add [pci] group and whitelist_sections to configure PCI passthrough

The current pci_passthrough_whitelist option using embedded json
causes issues for devstack [1].

This proposes a new section [pci] with a config variable
'whitelist_sections' that lists a number of individual sections to
describe the same PCI-passthrough options.  For example, two
white-lists might be defined as:

 [pci]
 whitelist_sections = pci_rule_foo, pci_rule_bar

 [pci_rule_foo]
 product_id = 1520
 vendor_id = 8086

 [pci_rule_bar]
 vendor_id = 1137
 product_id = 0071
 address = *:0a:00.*
 physical_network = physnet1

Note that we enforce the subsections having the "pci_rule_*" prefix to
avoid potential for namespace issues later.

This modifies class WhiteList() to take both the json strings from
pci_passthrough_whitelist and dictionaries created from
whitelist_sections.  Test-cases are updated to exercise the new
argument.

Use of pci_passthrough_whitelist will give a warning message about
it's deprecation, but both methods can co-exist.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-October/049341.html

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4b860e3f7901b00b1c78f7df1f2219132f347239
'}]
commit_message:
Add [pci] group and whitelist_sections to configure PCI passthrough

The current pci_passthrough_whitelist option using embedded json
causes issues for devstack [1].

This proposes a new section [pci] with a config variable
'whitelist_sections' that lists a number of individual sections to
describe the same PCI-passthrough options.  For example, two
white-lists might be defined as:

 [pci]
 whitelist_sections = pci_rule_foo, pci_rule_bar

 [pci_rule_foo]
 product_id = 1520
 vendor_id = 8086

 [pci_rule_bar]
 vendor_id = 1137
 product_id = 0071
 address = *:0a:00.*
 physical_network = physnet1

Note that we enforce the subsections having the "pci_rule_*" prefix to
avoid potential for namespace issues later.

This modifies class WhiteList() to take both the json strings from
pci_passthrough_whitelist and dictionaries created from
whitelist_sections.  Test-cases are updated to exercise the new
argument.

Use of pci_passthrough_whitelist will give a warning message about
it's deprecation, but both methods can co-exist.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-October/049341.html

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4b860e3f7901b00b1c78f7df1f2219132f347239

commit_message:
Disassociate floating ip when remove fixed ip

When remove fixed ip from an instance, related floating ip
should be disassociated. Otherwise the port_id and fixed_ip
will remain in the floating ip info.

Change-Id: Iadbcee41905a5e17e0c798fe2cbb168f1420b69c
Closes-Bug: #1525101

commit_message:
Libvirt: Pass correct kernel_id and ramdisk_id when do rescue

Currently, when use an image(such as cirros) which has kernel_id and
ramdisk_id to do rescue instance, the instance is failed to boot up.

Closes-Bug: #1530010
Change-Id: Ibcddcd20c62466a6d27bc49b37a0073fc13de64c

commit_message:
Add ContainerFormat field

Add a ContainerFormat field to hold the constants for container formats.
Added a NONE field because ContainerFormat is nullable, but was replaced
with an empty string in I770d394f65e5be6a5f8f36c673806f91509e0abe for
compatibility concerns.

Related-Bug: #1516137
Change-Id: Ifd5e0ccf7aee6f1fc4c57c3856dbdbd4db08a659

commit_message:
Create 'clustercheck' user only on primary controller.

It's not necessary to do it on all controllers. Part with
creating user in db was excluded from status.pp and it's
called separately on primary controller.

Change-Id: I9eb66b64bcae8077e2a7812ec769ddcadf470719
Closes-Bug: #1580243

Adds basic support for clustering VMs.

Adds HyperVClusterDriver.
Clusters VMs after they are created.
Unclusters VMs before they are destroyed.

Checks if the VM is clustered before live-migration. If the destination
is in the same cluster, performs clustered live-migration. If not, it
performs regular live-migration.

Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-cluster

Change-Id: I35b112e2a56942737d8c44b6edf3831d7f588e6b
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V Cluster implementation

Adds basic support for clustering VMs.

Adds HyperVClusterDriver.
Clusters VMs after they are created.
Unclusters VMs before they are destroyed.

Checks if the VM is clustered before live-migration. If the destination
is in the same cluster, performs clustered live-migration. If not, it
performs regular live-migration.

Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-cluster

Change-Id: I35b112e2a56942737d8c44b6edf3831d7f588e6b

commit_message:
Hyper-V vTPM Devices

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the ability
to attach vTPM devices to the Hyper-V VMs, offering the users the
posibility to use it to enhance their security and system
integrity.

This commit implements adding vTPM devices to instances.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7728388415e3bef5f312a3630458b89bb1622694
Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vtpm-devices

commit_message:
Change the default set of tox jobs to run

Select only the tox environments that are the most likely to catch
errors in a change before being submitted for review so that
simply running "tox" is more useful for developers.

Change-Id: I3880aeebb4a4326f774bc6c91f1498fd2d6b77fc

commit_message:
Improve the performance of get instances

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,
it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the
instances in db.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current
host to filter the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1486026

Change-Id: I6496932f20df7f7819bd640db1e1865b01ac5a8d

commit_message:
Implements proper UUID format for 7 modules from unit/api/openstack/compute/

Currently some of the unittests are using non valid UUID format
for the FieldType UUID.

This is preparation work to add UUID validation in the
oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Without this change adding validation will cause tests to fail.

Change-Id: Ifa69715a8455348956f4b563426928327cd634f9

commit_message:
API sample testing without project_id

This implements an new api paste fixture which swaps out our noauth
middleware with one that doesn't add the project_id into the
urls.

Update the link fixer in the ApiSamples matching code to also update
for optional project_id. This is the least worse approach here,
because if we set request_api_version, then we have to duplicate the
entire template tree as well, which we definitely don't want to do, as
it now correctly handles either url form.

This updates the auth tests to bifurcate with testscenarios instead of
the subclass model, which makes for more consistent tests.

Implements bp:service-catalog-tng

Change-Id: Ib639e92f360499a3292528768bf95aadc8d9e564

commit_message:
Decrease task timeouts according to actual duration

Most of tasks had timeout equal to 3600 seconds whereas actual duration
is no more than 1 minute.
Minimal timeout is 60 seconds even if task is complete in a few seconds.
New timeout ~ duration * 2.5

Change-Id: Iea9ee8f5038f5fcfd9dcdfc2d9ba964eab035549
Closes-bug: #1558505

commit_message:
To allow server search option metadata for non-admin

Currently server search metadata option is silently discarded
for non-admins. so we add a new microversion that will allow this
filter to be applied.

Change-Id: I2483c270ff2e2db4c72920a1e8bc85c612e002a5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 18:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "WIP: libvirt storage pools initial step

This code has never been executed. It undoubtedly contains not only
logical errors, but also syntax errors. Tests haven't been touched at
all, except by automated refactoring. Don't bother looking at the
changes to the tests: they're meaningless.

This change introduces StoragePolicy as a replacement interface for
Backend. There are a few reasons for this change. Firstly, it starts
to centralise code which assumes the placement of disks. This makes
the existing behaviour simpler to follow. Note that this change
attempts to be minimally functional, simply to centralise the existing
behaviour. Sometimes that behaviour doesn't make much sense, for
example the shared storage detection, but we have at least centralised
the problem.

Secondly, we have a goal of changing this placement in moving to
libvirt storage pools. The StoragePolicy interface gives us a hook to
make that change. I anticipate that StoragePolicy will become
LegacyStoragePolicy and will remain in place. We can then use a hook
on storage_policy_for_instance() to select the correct policy for an
existing instance, and to run an upgrade if required.

This change makes 1 slightly less mechanical non-functional change:
Image.import_file -> Image.import_local_file.  This allowed me to
remove an if block on default image type, as well as being more
readable.

This change makes one functional change out of expediency: snapshot
was the only code using disk paths from the libvirt xml rather than
inferring them from nova state. Although the libvirt xml is a source
of absolute truth, if it doesn't correspond to expectations we're
already broken. Rather than maintain 2 very different interfaces, I
have consolidated to using nova state. If this is wrong, it was going
to break somewhere else anyway. It is also simpler to validate.

Going from here, we need to split Image into StoragePool and
StorageVolume. Operations like cache() and create_image() are
operations on the pool. Operations like libvirt_info, resize, and
snapshot_extract are operations on a volume. The StoragePolicy will
create singletons for each pool, and pools will create volumes.

We can then implement new StoragePools which use libvirt, and a new
StoragePolicy which returns them.

StoragePool needs a cleanup_for_instance() method.

N.B. ImageCacheManager is not recoverable. It assumes on-disk layout
everywhere. It is extremely hard to follow. It is extremely hard to
validate. Its structure and code flow are undesirable. It will
continue to manage the 'legacy' storage pools, but the new storage
pools will be managed by a new image cache manager, which will require
a new periodic task.

Change-Id: I500912a10ac948543565801d994a2f49db27880e
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: libvirt storage pools initial step

This code has never been executed. It undoubtedly contains not only
logical errors, but also syntax errors. Tests haven't been touched at
all, except by automated refactoring. Don't bother looking at the
changes to the tests: they're meaningless.

This change introduces StoragePolicy as a replacement interface for
Backend. There are a few reasons for this change. Firstly, it starts
to centralise code which assumes the placement of disks. This makes
the existing behaviour simpler to follow. Note that this change
attempts to be minimally functional, simply to centralise the existing
behaviour. Sometimes that behaviour doesn't make much sense, for
example the shared storage detection, but we have at least centralised
the problem.

Secondly, we have a goal of changing this placement in moving to
libvirt storage pools. The StoragePolicy interface gives us a hook to
make that change. I anticipate that StoragePolicy will become
LegacyStoragePolicy and will remain in place. We can then use a hook
on storage_policy_for_instance() to select the correct policy for an
existing instance, and to run an upgrade if required.

This change makes 1 slightly less mechanical non-functional change:
Image.import_file -> Image.import_local_file.  This allowed me to
remove an if block on default image type, as well as being more
readable.

This change makes one functional change out of expediency: snapshot
was the only code using disk paths from the libvirt xml rather than
inferring them from nova state. Although the libvirt xml is a source
of absolute truth, if it doesn't correspond to expectations we're
already broken. Rather than maintain 2 very different interfaces, I
have consolidated to using nova state. If this is wrong, it was going
to break somewhere else anyway. It is also simpler to validate.

Going from here, we need to split Image into StoragePool and
StorageVolume. Operations like cache() and create_image() are
operations on the pool. Operations like libvirt_info, resize, and
snapshot_extract are operations on a volume. The StoragePolicy will
create singletons for each pool, and pools will create volumes.

We can then implement new StoragePools which use libvirt, and a new
StoragePolicy which returns them.

StoragePool needs a cleanup_for_instance() method.

N.B. ImageCacheManager is not recoverable. It assumes on-disk layout
everywhere. It is extremely hard to follow. It is extremely hard to
validate. Its structure and code flow are undesirable. It will
continue to manage the 'legacy' storage pools, but the new storage
pools will be managed by a new image cache manager, which will require
a new periodic task.

Change-Id: I500912a10ac948543565801d994a2f49db27880e

In Kilo (and earlier), the pci_alias is a json docstring that encodes a
dictionary. This patch adds the list support to pci_alias, and both list and

commit_message:
Support configuration of multiple pci_alias within an array

In Kilo (and earlier), the pci_alias is a json docstring that encodes a
dictionary. This patch adds the list support to pci_alias, and both list and
dict are now supported.

Note: The pci_alias configuration is now aligned with packstack
(see manifests/api.pp in puppet-nova).

DocImpact
Change-Id: I21683daa4fa53d901a9e7dc6dbe366ebcc57bcd5
Closes-Bug: #1513513

PPC/S390 architectures currently do not support Spice protocol.

commit_message:
libvirt: Handle unsupported Spice feature per arch

PPC/S390 architectures currently do not support Spice protocol.
So we raise an exception if the feature is enabled in the
configuration and make sure the exception raises for any test
that enables spice.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1494354
Co-Authored-By: Rafael Folco <rfolco@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I823b44ba65ec6c7aabf8f3e1b962b10d4d5257aa

commit_message:
Use ContainerFormat instead of strings

There's a lot of strings out there for using the different container
formats. Well, hopefully this changes all of them over to use
ContainerFormat.

Closes-Bug: #1516137

commit_message:
Iteratively generate host states from 'get_all_host_states'

Instead of fetching all the hosts, updating to there most accurate
information and then yielding all known hosts back we can do this
iteratively instead (which avoids needless computation in the case
where a filtering happens early).

This method was previously returning an iterator, which it now does
as well (and iterator/generator is now returned), just that instead of
processing first, then returning that iterator, this processing is
done as needed (more lazily) instead.

Change-Id: Icd255fe5135884b1e32b65dbc09a346a9d415e1c

commit_message:
Introduce Flavor Classes

Introduce the concept of Flavor classes by changes at
Object/DB/SqlAlchemy layer. With this patch a new field
called as 'flavor_class' is introduced to the Flavor
object and DB/SqlAlchemy layer. This change will handle
changes to create, delete, list and show the flavor with
new field flavor class. Please note there will be
seperate client side patch to reflect CLI changes.

Change-Id: I3926e3b3972032b80bc67ecce133f8dc95321f80
Partially-Implements: bp flavor-classes

    del agg['aggregate']['metadata']

subject: add script to expire old bug reports
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-25 15:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['expire_old_bug_reports.py'], 'message': "add script to expire old bug reports

Many OpenStack projects face the issue to have more bug reports than
they can handle with the resources they got. The chances, that the
same setting which leads to the observed issue is still there, is quite
often unlikely. It's better to be explicit and expire old bug reports
which will not get any attention any more.

Change-Id: I3c9c72b528b090647211262d2f0030d66be9857c
"}]
commit_message:
add script to expire old bug reports

Many OpenStack projects face the issue to have more bug reports than
they can handle with the resources they got. The chances, that the
same setting which leads to the observed issue is still there, is quite
often unlikely. It's better to be explicit and expire old bug reports
which will not get any attention any more.

Change-Id: I3c9c72b528b090647211262d2f0030d66be9857c

subject: Enable proxy header parsing for heat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 07:09:25.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/heat-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable proxy header parsing for heat

For handling the X-Forwarded-Proto, heat uses the http_proxy_to_wsgi
middleware from oslo.middleware. It used to work by default, but now
configuration is required to enable that. We require it since we are
effectively behind a proxy (HAProxy).

Change-Id: I256f27ec6a3f66316ff6aa3f78b2f1ec1472f097
'}]
commit_message:
Enable proxy header parsing for heat

For handling the X-Forwarded-Proto, heat uses the http_proxy_to_wsgi
middleware from oslo.middleware. It used to work by default, but now
configuration is required to enable that. We require it since we are
effectively behind a proxy (HAProxy).

Change-Id: I256f27ec6a3f66316ff6aa3f78b2f1ec1472f097

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-19 15:21:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/keystone/keystone_spec.rb'], 'message': "Update keystone noop tests for wsgi files

Change I03a7a057cae0bf86331191faf47ec394487150a7 is updating the source
path of the wsgi files used to configure keystone under apache. This
change updates the noop tests to just check that the files exist and
configured in the catalog but to exclude the path information.  Once the
change in upstream gets merged, we could add the path information back
in but fuel really shouldn't care where it lives so long as they are
configured.  The upstream tests should be relied on to ensure the
source/destination paths are managed correctly.

Change-Id: I9969185306c77254e781b2c52a6b9bededf40a98
Related-Bug: #1539201
"}]
commit_message:
Update keystone noop tests for wsgi files

Change I03a7a057cae0bf86331191faf47ec394487150a7 is updating the source
path of the wsgi files used to configure keystone under apache. This
change updates the noop tests to just check that the files exist and
configured in the catalog but to exclude the path information.  Once the
change in upstream gets merged, we could add the path information back
in but fuel really shouldn't care where it lives so long as they are
configured.  The upstream tests should be relied on to ensure the
source/destination paths are managed correctly.

Change-Id: I9969185306c77254e781b2c52a6b9bededf40a98
Related-Bug: #1539201

commit_message:
Add test with detached haproxy role

- Add test with external load balancer. Controllers are
from different racks and haproxy is from rack-3
- Separate devops config with appropriate networks
assigned to nodes is used
- Local repos for cluster are used because public networks
are routed without internet connection
- OSTF isn't running because it's not implied to use
separate haproxy

Closes-Bug: #1583530

Change-Id: I0d3647c8eb13159c27e64ddf5925467f451b610c

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-05-25 15:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/get-me-a-network.rst'], 'message': 'Get Me a Network

Neutron added the ``auto-allocate-topology`` API in Mitaka [1]_. Nova intends
on using this API to automatically allocate a private network for a project
when creating server instance if no specific network is provided in the create
request and none are available to the project. This should also bring some
feature parity for the server create flow between Neutron and nova-network.

Spec for blueprint get-me-a-network

APIImpact

Change-Id: If34d760deb5fc1c580b4c84d0a569b532bd1385f
'}]
commit_message:
Get Me a Network

Neutron added the ``auto-allocate-topology`` API in Mitaka [1]_. Nova intends
on using this API to automatically allocate a private network for a project
when creating server instance if no specific network is provided in the create
request and none are available to the project. This should also bring some
feature parity for the server create flow between Neutron and nova-network.

Spec for blueprint get-me-a-network

APIImpact

Change-Id: If34d760deb5fc1c580b4c84d0a569b532bd1385f

commit_message:
Make swift-proxy_storage run first on primary controller

Swift services fail to start because the ring sync tasks fail if
secondary controllers run this task before primary created the ring.
Therefore, it is necessary to ensure that primary controller runs
first.

Change-Id: Id18bd79a0e0e187b5144288dcc175cc08d2db8e8
Closes-Bug: #1582609

commit_message:
Use puppetlabs/apache to set up cobbler's httpd configuration

We used to have ERb templates to set up httpd, used inside cobbler.
Puppetlabs already has an apache class which provides better
maintainability.

By using it we won't need to support two versions of configuration
templates (for httpd 2.2 and 2.4).

Change-Id: I49593960e613aaa8ba6d024cbc48c665bd62eb3c
Closes-Bug: 1535357

Change-Id: Id78fcc9e85f869650331da76940d423f21ee5d01
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor DNAT and OVS configurations

1. Add the external bridge when DNAT is enabled

2. Add an option for integration_bridge just like ovs-agent

3. Fix the documentation for 'DF_Q_SVC_MASTER'

Closes-Bug: #1583595
Change-Id: Id78fcc9e85f869650331da76940d423f21ee5d01

subject: Refactor hostname resolution via DNS
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 08:59:31.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbit_utils.py', 'hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py', 'hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'message': 'Refactor hostname resolution via DNS

Due to oddities in the way that DNS used to work on older MAAS
versions, specifically when using LXC containers, the charm
would endeavour to discover a full forward/reverse resolvable
hostname/ip address to use when clustering with peers, and to
set the internal nodename for each RMQ instance.

Changes in MAAS 2.0 mean that an IP address may resolve to more
than 1 DNS record, making identification via DNS of the FQDN
problematic.

The charm actively manages /etc/hosts with IP address/hostname for
all peer units in a RMQ cluster using the cluster relation; make
use of this feature to allow the internal nodename of each unit
to actually be the hostname of the server, as the charm is ensuring
the resolvability of hostnames within the cluster.

To avoid races where the lead unit has not had its hostname written
to /etc/hosts, only cluster with the lead unit in the hook execution
where this actually happens.

Change-Id: Ia400c3b6e2cb1a5f2ee6f5fe98b5437033e02024
Closes-Bug: 1584902
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor hostname resolution via DNS

Due to oddities in the way that DNS used to work on older MAAS
versions, specifically when using LXC containers, the charm
would endeavour to discover a full forward/reverse resolvable
hostname/ip address to use when clustering with peers, and to
set the internal nodename for each RMQ instance.

Changes in MAAS 2.0 mean that an IP address may resolve to more
than 1 DNS record, making identification via DNS of the FQDN
problematic.

The charm actively manages /etc/hosts with IP address/hostname for
all peer units in a RMQ cluster using the cluster relation; make
use of this feature to allow the internal nodename of each unit
to actually be the hostname of the server, as the charm is ensuring
the resolvability of hostnames within the cluster.

To avoid races where the lead unit has not had its hostname written
to /etc/hosts, only cluster with the lead unit in the hook execution
where this actually happens.

Change-Id: Ia400c3b6e2cb1a5f2ee6f5fe98b5437033e02024
Closes-Bug: 1584902

Add Panko to Telemetry

Panko is a spin-off of the event API subsystem of Ceilometer. It's based
on the same code, that will be later removed from Ceilometer.

commit_message:
Break calls to get_devices_details_list into subsets

This change breaks the devices list into subsets when calling
get_devices_details_list to avoid rpc timeouts in scaled up environments.
Added a unit test to verify that the device list chunking works correctly.

Change-Id: I01c4bd8675a63093feb3964757c338b28b4e402a
Closes-Bug: #1430999

With change 648099e1925e7d0d3f6906e5e8d15f3871e88460 and the replacement

commit_message:
Remove the delay resource and its constraints

With change 648099e1925e7d0d3f6906e5e8d15f3871e88460 and the replacement
of ceilometer-alarm with aodh, the delay resource became a leaf in the
ordering graph and serves no real purpose any longer.

It can now be removed without affecting anything else.

Change-Id: Ib86e609821b9f0b7b0d99c49aead20f9a177f63d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 16:01:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py'], 'message': "Don't disallow quota deletion if allocated < 0

Due to the race condition http://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1552944,
it's possible that a volume delete on a project at the same time as a
change to/from a -1 limit on the project could double count the change
in allocated value. This has the possibility to set allocated < 0, and
in order to handle this situation as gracefully as possible, we should
not disallow quota deletion in the case that allocated < 0.

Change-Id: Ic35ff9671024aa1cecc04b205d1b7cba56bbea61
Closes-Bug: #1554173
(cherry picked from commit edff6fbf5d80dba05ab57b557ee25f44098bdf13)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't disallow quota deletion if allocated < 0

Due to the race condition http://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1552944,
it's possible that a volume delete on a project at the same time as a
change to/from a -1 limit on the project could double count the change
in allocated value. This has the possibility to set allocated < 0, and
in order to handle this situation as gracefully as possible, we should
not disallow quota deletion in the case that allocated < 0.

Change-Id: Ic35ff9671024aa1cecc04b205d1b7cba56bbea61
Closes-Bug: #1554173
(cherry picked from commit edff6fbf5d80dba05ab57b557ee25f44098bdf13)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 08:53:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix for 'ofport' query retries during neutron agent start

When agent starts up, it checks whether patch ports exists
before adding them. But the routine used to query the
patch port's existence is get_port_ofport() which retries
the opertation because of the @_ofport_retry decoration.
This creates an unwanted delay in the startup of the
agent, when the port do not exist.
The port's existence can be checked with port_exists()
call on the bridge with no retries.

Change-Id: I9fac0066d6c03491536a6e2718d6340acd275d9d
Closes-Bug: #1579769
(cherry picked from commit d526e720f73cbd79e54bbed18fe3009cad1cee10)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for 'ofport' query retries during neutron agent start

When agent starts up, it checks whether patch ports exists
before adding them. But the routine used to query the
patch port's existence is get_port_ofport() which retries
the opertation because of the @_ofport_retry decoration.
This creates an unwanted delay in the startup of the
agent, when the port do not exist.
The port's existence can be checked with port_exists()
call on the bridge with no retries.

Change-Id: I9fac0066d6c03491536a6e2718d6340acd275d9d
Closes-Bug: #1579769
(cherry picked from commit d526e720f73cbd79e54bbed18fe3009cad1cee10)

The process to discover plugins uses stevedore extension manager.  This

commit_message:
Fix tempest_tests.plugin no module error

The process to discover plugins uses stevedore extension manager.  This
method tries to load test_plugin module which is not present in an
initial tempest installation.  This method uses a existing module for
loading those modules.

Change-Id: If47f71677bd4e966ed7c419a04a2bc72f0902619
Closes-Bug: #1579249

commit_message:
Apply network templates before preupgrade handler

  Controller's "preupgrade" handler replaces
  deployment_info if "isolated". After that
  Octane applies network template.

  But nailgun will NOT apply any new settings
  if replaced_deployment_info exists for node.

  Closes-bug: 1572240

Change-Id: I06922a59a5f6976acb7c268460fb95fcde86aa54

commit_message:
Replace tempest-lib with tempest.lib

Since tempest-lib is deprecated for future bug-fixes and code changes
in favor of tempest, so Zaqar's tempest code need to be changed
accordingly. See
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest-lib/readme.html

Change-Id: I095e8ea3fe09fa9b4e81c6a25abe200b5d5fcd15

subject: Introduce provision states: AVAILABLE, ENROLL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 19:50:03.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/baremetal_manager.py'], 'message': 'Introduce provision states: AVAILABLE, ENROLL

BaremetalProvisionStates.NOSTATE (``None``) was replaced by AVAILABLE
("available") in Ironic version 1.2. ENROLL ("enroll") state was introduced
in version 1.12.  This patch also updates the
BaremetalScenarioTest.terminate_instance method to wait for etiher NOSTATE
or AVAILABLE.

Change-Id: I067504e49f68929298c91e61819aa9a61169fe52
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce provision states: AVAILABLE, ENROLL

BaremetalProvisionStates.NOSTATE (``None``) was replaced by AVAILABLE
("available") in Ironic version 1.2. ENROLL ("enroll") state was introduced
in version 1.12.  This patch also updates the
BaremetalScenarioTest.terminate_instance method to wait for etiher NOSTATE
or AVAILABLE.

Change-Id: I067504e49f68929298c91e61819aa9a61169fe52

of a local variable so nested calls to time_* might have issues.

commit_message:
Fix troveclient to support Mistral

The troveclient was changed to have the Paginated object
derive from "list" rather than containing it.  This change
reflects that change in the management int-tests.

commit_message:
Remove premature vnf delete from db

Hold the vnf in "PENDING_DELETE" state until underlying heat-stack
deletion is complete.
Closes-bug: #1554663

Change-Id: I5c52a9fc55950355f9122cc907f41cb8b9217a5c

commit_message:
ovo - switch cluster lock and node lock calls

This patch switch cluster lock and node lock calls to use lock objects
instead of going directly to database. This also fixed some bugs found
in previous patches in this series.

Change-Id: I66477197bb111f4ed4be7e961764cc7d56bedd41

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 10:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/api.py', 'nova/conf/availability_zone.py'], 'message': 'api and availablity_zone opt definition consistent

Looking at the option defintions, more consistent, so its easier to
maintain.

* multiple options grouped into a lists, not every option named
* one register_opts call per group, to match list_opts
* ALL_OPTS created by composing lots of lists
* using string keys in list_opts until the oslo bug is fixed

blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I66b2a87c3158781477ce962f9c6853efea415dad
'}]
commit_message:
api and availablity_zone opt definition consistent

Looking at the option defintions, more consistent, so its easier to
maintain.

* multiple options grouped into a lists, not every option named
* one register_opts call per group, to match list_opts
* ALL_OPTS created by composing lots of lists
* using string keys in list_opts until the oslo bug is fixed

blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I66b2a87c3158781477ce962f9c6853efea415dad

commit_message:
Do not rebuild revoke_tree on each validate-token

Currently, the revoke_tree gets rebuilt on every validate-token call. Instead build it only when
a new entry is added to revocation_event table.

Change-Id: Ia3274373c7e0cda64293f03e5db3babc63228293
Closes-Bug: #1503312

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-26 18:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix Keystone url version suffix when webpath is present

There was a false assumption within utils.fix_auth_url_version()
routine that everything that goes after hostname:port part of Keystone
auth_url is could be only version suffix. Once '/identity' webpath was
enabled in Keystone Apache configuration in Devstack by default, the
falsehood was exposed and broken all integration tests. This is fixed.

While debugging fix_auth_url_version() I noticed another side-effect
of the fix: Horizon no longer needs to specify version suffix inside
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL setting, the fixed function works perfectly
without it. This will be mentioned in release notes for the dependent
Horizon patch.

Partial-Bug: #1585682
Needed-By: Icebfc291ec2b06ed84934c75cfd8c9d91cb2a895
Change-Id: Iea9b8e8378e6c5fb4c60df0073968d8caf7fbc5e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Keystone url version suffix when webpath is present

There was a false assumption within utils.fix_auth_url_version()
routine that everything that goes after hostname:port part of Keystone
auth_url is could be only version suffix. Once '/identity' webpath was
enabled in Keystone Apache configuration in Devstack by default, the
falsehood was exposed and broken all integration tests. This is fixed.

While debugging fix_auth_url_version() I noticed another side-effect
of the fix: Horizon no longer needs to specify version suffix inside
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL setting, the fixed function works perfectly
without it. This will be mentioned in release notes for the dependent
Horizon patch.

Partial-Bug: #1585682
Needed-By: Icebfc291ec2b06ed84934c75cfd8c9d91cb2a895
Change-Id: Iea9b8e8378e6c5fb4c60df0073968d8caf7fbc5e

commit_message:
Add identity providers integration tests

This patch adds a first set of tests in the keystone tempest plugin.
These tests are for the Identity Provider API (part of the Federated
Identity API).

To run the tests install keystone and run (in tempest):

    $ tox -e all-plugin -- keystone

Change-Id: I64ebba2e57aa952a2262f9e0ad143cea7de259c0

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 16:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['docker/neutron/neutron-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Install correct version of arping

Currently Ubuntu source installation loads arping package which is version
2.11. It does not support -U keyword which is used by lbaas.

Change-Id: I64c5e5b40e561d309281204b4f6aeaf0fb395cb5
Closes-Bug: #1586085
'}]
commit_message:
Install correct version of arping

Currently Ubuntu source installation loads arping package which is version
2.11. It does not support -U keyword which is used by lbaas.
iputil-arping package should be used instead.

Change-Id: I64c5e5b40e561d309281204b4f6aeaf0fb395cb5
Closes-Bug: #1586085

subject: Move _get_subnet_from_cache to common/acl
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 19:05:55.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/common/acl.py'], 'message': 'Move _get_subnet_from_cache to common/acl

This patch moves _get_subnet_from_cache to common/acl in order to
move all the acl code out of the ml2 driver and to enable us to
remove the duplicated code from the ovn_core plugin until its removed
so the same acl code is used between the two plugins.

Change-Id: I9936b8e889cd7088b540a224fafaefac5cd4a543
'}]
commit_message:
Move _get_subnet_from_cache to common/acl

This patch moves _get_subnet_from_cache to common/acl in order to
move all the acl code out of the ml2 driver and to enable us to
remove the duplicated code from the ovn_core plugin until its removed
so the same acl code is used between the two plugins.

Change-Id: I9936b8e889cd7088b540a224fafaefac5cd4a543

commit_message:
Add time_elapsed to timekeeping functions

time_elapsed returns the amount of time that has passed since
start_time was called.

This is useful if multiple calls are needed within a time_start
time_stop sequence in order to properly honor a time limit.

Change-Id: Iae9df5abffa8048395f61bf0384a8e32ebccec7e

Detect PowerNV environment

The os_nova role can now detect a PowerNV environment and set the
nova_virt_type variable to 'kvm'.

commit_message:
[DOCS] Adding missing kernel modules for VPNaaS

Without adding the three kernel modules missing
in the network hosts, ipsec will fail because
he needs them in order to work.

With this modules it's possible to have VPNaaS
agent be working.

Change-Id: I0c0a7b46f6f486e8e18f741dd9c6a1c691e937af

subject: go: have replicateDevice go routine loop per device
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-26 16:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/replicator_test.go', 'go/objectserver/replicator.go'], 'message': "go: have replicateDevice go routine loop per device

This will prevent a slow disk from slowing down replication
on all the rest of the server.

This also changes the meaning of the replicator recon report. Since
we won't be waiting for the replicator to complete the whole
server the object_replication_time will be the average of
the replication time of all the devices. It won't be set until
there has been a complete pass on all the devices. This is a
little strange but I'm leaving it there for some backwards
compatibility.

The previous whole device replication times were a little misleading if
most the drives are done and it is still running on a few slow drives.
The new model makes the replication stats per drive and instead of
reporting them in recon it has a new API call to the replicator's
http server at /progress .  I could also add these per-drive stats
into recon but i will leave that as a further patch if somebody
wants it. I'm going to try to use the /progress call to get what I need.

The object replicator itself will monitor the progress of the
replicators and restart the go routines if one of them has not
reported for 4 hours.

Change-Id: Ifa5defbe684329979a533b558a57c38ac029ada1
"}]
commit_message:
go: have replicateDevice go routine loop per device

This will prevent a slow disk from slowing down replication
on all the rest of the server.

This also changes the meaning of the replicator recon report. Since
we won't be waiting for the replicator to complete the whole
server the object_replication_time will be the average of
the replication time of all the devices. It won't be set until
there has been a complete pass on all the devices. This is a
little strange but I'm leaving it there for some backwards
compatibility.

The previous whole device replication times were a little misleading if
most the drives are done and it is still running on a few slow drives.
The new model makes the replication stats per drive and instead of
reporting them in recon it has a new API call to the replicator's
http server at /progress .  I could also add these per-drive stats
into recon but i will leave that as a further patch if somebody
wants it. I'm going to try to use the /progress call to get what I need.

The object replicator itself will monitor the progress of the
replicators and restart the go routines if one of them has not
reported for 4 hours.

Change-Id: Ifa5defbe684329979a533b558a57c38ac029ada1

commit_message:
Fix Brcd lookup service to use defined southbound protocol

Adds support to the lookup service to use the config
option for southbound communication to the FC switch
which is already being used by the brcd driver.

Closes-Bug: #1557737

Change-Id: Ie3189832641ceca9d38298bafb68e6e4860b0a08

and this sometimes could lead to test failure

subject: Add other-requirements.txt for bindep
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 19:13:03.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: Ife02ab3e5af84180d419925ca2766d38c45f465b
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: Ife02ab3e5af84180d419925ca2766d38c45f465b
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: loadbalancer: make sure controller_* are array-typed
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-26 14:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "loadbalancer: make sure controller_* are array-typed

Make sure controller_hosts_real and controller_hosts_names_real become
array-types anyway, so we don't need to add brackets in Hiera lookups
(example on both undercloud & overcloud where we do [hiera('controller_host')]).

Change-Id: I2fe899482acfd51919262bc7a6a1c9f450e173f4
"}]
commit_message:
loadbalancer: make sure controller_* are array-typed

Make sure controller_hosts_real and controller_hosts_names_real become
array-types anyway, so we don't need to add brackets in Hiera lookups
(example on both undercloud & overcloud where we do [hiera('controller_host')]).

Change-Id: I2fe899482acfd51919262bc7a6a1c9f450e173f4

subject: Fixes NFV VNFFG and groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 00:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['toscaparser/extensions/nfv/TOSCA_nfv_definition_1_0.yaml', 'toscaparser/groups.py'], 'message': 'Fixes NFV VNFFG and groups

Fixes Include:
 - nfv.VNFFG type does not include "targets" in its properties in the
   TOSCA NFV spec.  The usage of "targets" should actually be "members"
   which is defined in the core group.Root definition.
 - Removes vnf.VNFFG requirements which are not part of the spec.
 - Fixes reference to TARGETS in groups.py SECTIONS

Change-Id: I0990eb9c1339943b420a2896c4cc59663a328393
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes NFV VNFFG and groups

Fixes Include:
 - nfv.VNFFG type does not include "targets" in its properties in the
   TOSCA NFV spec.  The usage of "targets" should actually be "members"
   which is defined in the core group.Root definition.
 - Removes vnf.VNFFG requirements which are not part of the spec.
 - Fixes reference to TARGETS in groups.py SECTIONS

Change-Id: I0990eb9c1339943b420a2896c4cc59663a328393
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

subject: Enable LSM instead of checking status
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-26 14:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-notes/V-51337.rst', 'tasks/main.yml', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-lsm-bae903e463079a3f.yaml', 'tasks/lsm.yml', 'tasks/misc.yml', 'tox.ini', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Enable LSM instead of checking status

This patch enables the appropriate Linux Security Module (LSM) for the system
rather than simply checking it. This brings the role more in line with the
STIG requirements and allows it to be used as a more generic role in other
non-OpenStack-Ansible deployments.

It shouldn't affect OpenStack-Ansible deployments since AppArmor is expected
to be running in those deployments.

Documentation and release notes are included.

Change-Id: Ia017f12be0d60ea74b54396bc8278e4db92295ba
"}]
commit_message:
Enable LSM instead of checking status

This patch enables the appropriate Linux Security Module (LSM) for the system
rather than simply checking it. This brings the role more in line with the
STIG requirements and allows it to be used as a more generic role in other
non-OpenStack-Ansible deployments.

It shouldn't affect OpenStack-Ansible deployments since AppArmor is expected
to be running in those deployments.

Documentation and release notes are included.

Change-Id: Ia017f12be0d60ea74b54396bc8278e4db92295ba

commit_message:
Save all instance extras in a single db call

Currently, changes to instance fields backed by instance_extras table
trigger separate db calls for each individual change when calling
save() on the instance. This reworks that so that all changes gets
saved with a single call to the db.

Change-Id: I2ddcb625ca54f18b1a68f8ddd1f28e541f438a74

subject: make ovs driver to support update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-05-24 18:30:32.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/cli/port_chain.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/cli/test_port_chain.py', 'networking_sfc/extensions/sfc.py', 'networking_sfc/db/sfc_db.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/extensions/test_sfc.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/test_driver.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/db/test_sfc_db.py'], 'message': 'make ovs driver to support update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups

  - add api support to update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups.
  - add cli support to update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups.
  - add ovs driver support by deleting the old port chain then
  - add the new port chain. The advantage of this ovs driver change is
    as follows: First it simplifies the logic. Second the old logic has
    some fault even only modifying the flow classifiers, the new logic will
    not have this kind of problem. The disadvantage of this ovs driver change
    is as follows: First it will generates more flow rules in multiple rpcs.
    Second if the multiple rpcs are reordered, the ovs agent will not deal
    with correctly. Third it will have short time breakage during the flow
    rules updating period. For problem two and three, there is the same
    problem in old logic but the change makes it more severe.
  - add unittests coverage for the change.

Change-Id: Ib55d8ce0dc717fa1c097149be2ac4d45e9dd73b4
Closes-Bug: #1537023
'}]
commit_message:
make ovs driver to support update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups

  - add api support to update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups.
  - add cli support to update port chain with modifying port-pair-groups.
  - add ovs driver support by deleting the old port chain then
  - add the new port chain. The advantage of this ovs driver change is
    as follows: First it simplifies the logic. Second the old logic has
    some fault even only modifying the flow classifiers, the new logic will
    not have this kind of problem. The disadvantage of this ovs driver change
    is as follows: First it will generates more flow rules in multiple rpcs.
    Second if the multiple rpcs are reordered, the ovs agent will not deal
    with correctly. Third it will have short time breakage during the flow
    rules updating period. For problem two and three, there is the same
    problem in old logic but the change makes it more severe.
  - add unittests coverage for the change.

Change-Id: Ib55d8ce0dc717fa1c097149be2ac4d45e9dd73b4
Closes-Bug: #1537023

commit_message:
Change use_neutron_default_nets to be a boolean opt

This was incorrectly marked as a string option which caused
"true" or "1" to not be considerd a true value.

Change-Id: Ifd6f543674b3b34f50edb30a28d2d9fc67c79a8d

subject: Refactor puppe-openstack-integration jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-25 13:29:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Refactor puppe-openstack-integration jobs

TL;DR, here's what we want:

openstack/puppet-openstack-integration to run:
* check:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
  - all puppet4 scenarios, non-voting
* gate:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* experimental:
  - puppet3 + puppet4 + all scenarios on Xenial
* periodic:
  - drop puppet4 jobs (move them to check)

openstack/puppet-* modules to run:
* check:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* gate:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* experimental:
  - all puppet4 scenarios, non-voting
  - puppet3 + puppet4 + all scenarios on Xenial

Long version:

Previously, we used to run puppet4 jobs in experimental AND periodic
pipelines.

We noticed that puppet4 jobs are breaking quite often and periodic jobs
are not enough for us since we don't have any notification to let us
know of failures. Indeed, the jobs appear in
http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/ but only when Tempest
runs. Most of the failures don't reach Tempest run and fail before.

We think that we should start running puppet4 jobs in our check
pipeline, and we chose puppet-openstack-integration as a first
iteration, since this project does not have a lot of commits.

This patch does:

In Jenkins:
* Modify puppet-openstack-integration job-template:
  - stop using {pipeline} since everything will be in gate.
  - add {job-suffix} so we can use '-nv' later.
* Add '-nv' suffix to:
  - Xenial Puppet 3 job (we consider it experimental).
  - All Puppet 4 jobs.
* Do not use '-nv' jobs for those that we consider voting (puppet3 jobs
  on trusty & centos7).

In Zuul layout:
* Create puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv with all puppet4 jobs
  Note: we didn't add puppet3 job on Xenial because we want to keep it
  experimental (non-voting and run on demand) for now.
* Execute puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv jobs in
  puppet-openstack-integration project (not much commits per day, so
  won't consume a lot of resources).
* Create puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-exp-nv with the same jobs
  as puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv but using
  experimental pipeline. These jobs will be created for Puppet modules
  CI so we can check them at demand.
* Add '-nv' suffix to all jobs that we consider non-voting, experimental
  or not.

Change-Id: I339d41e32ca6f682d6736986be351166b91cf103
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor puppe-openstack-integration jobs

TL;DR, here's what we want:

openstack/puppet-openstack-integration to run:
* check:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
  - all puppet4 scenarios, non-voting
* gate:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* experimental:
  - puppet3 + puppet4 + all scenarios on Xenial
* periodic:
  - drop puppet4 jobs (move them to check)

openstack/puppet-* modules to run:
* check:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* gate:
  - all puppet3 scenarios, voting (no change)
* experimental:
  - all puppet4 scenarios, non-voting
  - puppet3 + puppet4 + all scenarios on Xenial

Long version:

Previously, we used to run puppet4 jobs in experimental AND periodic
pipelines.

We noticed that puppet4 jobs are breaking quite often and periodic jobs
are not enough for us since we don't have any notification to let us
know of failures. Indeed, the jobs appear in
http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/ but only when Tempest
runs. Most of the failures don't reach Tempest run and fail before.

We think that we should start running puppet4 jobs in our check
pipeline, and we chose puppet-openstack-integration as a first
iteration, since this project does not have a lot of commits.

This patch does:

In Jenkins:
* Modify puppet-openstack-integration job-template:
  - stop using {pipeline} since everything will be in gate.
  - add {job-suffix} so we can use '-nv' later.
* Add '-nv' suffix to:
  - Xenial Puppet 3 job (we consider it experimental).
  - All Puppet 4 jobs.
* Do not use '-nv' jobs for those that we consider voting (puppet3 jobs
  on trusty & centos7).

In Zuul layout:
* Create puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv with all puppet4 jobs
  Note: we didn't add puppet3 job on Xenial because we want to keep it
  experimental (non-voting and run on demand) for now.
* Execute puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv jobs in
  puppet-openstack-integration project (not much commits per day, so
  won't consume a lot of resources).
* Create puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-exp-nv with the same jobs
  as puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-all-check-nv but using
  experimental pipeline. These jobs will be created for Puppet modules
  CI so we can check them at demand.
* Add '-nv' suffix to all jobs that we consider non-voting, experimental
  or not.

Change-Id: I339d41e32ca6f682d6736986be351166b91cf103

sample files dir structure.\n\nChange-Id: I9bbf0f6a2cd2d966a34ed13dbc498805bbde6a29\n"}]
commit_message:
Restructure api sample files

Currently we have sample files directory structure like:
api_samples/
   <resource-name>/
       <version1>/files (for specific version)
       <version2>/files (for specific version)
       files (for v2.1/v2)

But if we some microversion needs change in all API.
For Example:
- Id92251243d9e92f30e466419110fce5781304823
where it will end up with having '<microversion>' folder under
each API sample files dir which does not looks much readable
structure.

To make it more readable and organized we should have <version> dir
at top and their sample files under it.

Something like below-
api_samples/
   v2.1/
       files (for v2.1/v2)
   <version1>
       <resource-name>/
           files
   <version2>
       <resource-name>/
           files

This commit makes the above changes in api sample files dir structure.

Change-Id: I9bbf0f6a2cd2d966a34ed13dbc498805bbde6a29

commit_message:
libvirt: Minimal qemu version for discard support should depend on image backend.

"discard" option for raw images on FS, LVM and Ceph RBD was added in 1.5.0
(http://wiki.qemu.org/ChangeLog/1.5), and for QCOW2 images in 1.6.0
(http://wiki.qemu.org/ChangeLog/1.6).

Closes-Bug: #1461572
Change-Id: I91b9859ffe54cf19c9174f82e70396b1e77b4700

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-04 17:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': "Do not block instance boot on net without subnet

Booting an instance on a net without subnet (or what is the same on a
port without fixed_ips) leads to an error in nova compute because the
default security group cannot be applied without an IP on the port.
In order to catch this error earlier the NetworkRequiresSubnet and
PortRequiresFixedIP exceptions were introduced. If port_security_enabled
is False for either the net or the port that means security groups will
not be applied, we will not have an error, so we don't need to raise
the exceptions to catch the errors early.

See also: I043901491f60ea76dfbae879ce6e56acbd12f30c

Change-Id: I3c42bc9dc6cc3f1c49fb1a060928fc7701a2189d
Closes-Bug: #1304409
Related-Bug: #1175464
"}]
commit_message:
Do not block instance boot on net without subnet

Booting an instance on a net without subnet (or what is the same on a
port without fixed_ips) leads to an error in nova compute because the
default security group cannot be applied without an IP on the port.
In order to catch this error earlier the NetworkRequiresSubnet and
PortRequiresFixedIP exceptions were introduced. If port_security_enabled
is False for either the net or the port that means security groups will
not be applied, we will not have an error, so we don't need to raise
the exceptions to catch the errors early.

See also: I043901491f60ea76dfbae879ce6e56acbd12f30c

Change-Id: I3c42bc9dc6cc3f1c49fb1a060928fc7701a2189d
Closes-Bug: #1304409
Related-Bug: #1175464

Change-Id: Iaf8969a98ac08da0cebb8bc23e2cdab5ba9e1d09
"}]
commit_message:
Add a performance test for getting a detailed list of instances

Since we want to remove the cache in the AZ helper module, we want to make we don't
regress more than something acceptable for a quite wide cloud with 50 instances
running with 50 compute nodes.

Change-Id: Iaf8969a98ac08da0cebb8bc23e2cdab5ba9e1d09

But current sample files under doc/api_samples/ dir have /v2 in ref links
like- "href": "http://openstack.example.com/v2/

It is better to update the sample those files with /v2.1 versions in
ref links.

And for new sample files generation, make only v2.1 tests to write the new files
which will adds /v2.1 version in sample files not /v2

This patch updates logic to write new sample files only by v2.1 tests
and update all current files with v2.1 version.

NOTE- Those files are being generated newly (by deleting old one and
let v2.1 tests to regenerate those). So there are other changes than

Change-Id: I47ad69355a17eada1f5d00cc627929131018285c
'}]
commit_message:
Updating doc/api_samples/* with /v2.1 in ref links

Now functional sample files tests runs on both /v2 and /v2.1 endpoints.
But current sample files under doc/api_samples/ dir have /v2 in ref links
like- "href": "http://openstack.example.com/v2/

It is better to update the sample those files with /v2.1 versions in
ref links.

And for new sample files generation, make only v2.1 tests to write the new files
which will adds /v2.1 version in sample files not /v2

This patch updates logic to write new sample files only by v2.1 tests
and update all current files with v2.1 version.

NOTE- Those files are being generated newly (by deleting old one and
let v2.1 tests to regenerate those). So there are other changes than
/v2.1 ref also like dates update etc.
IMO, we should have all those old data also updated in sample files

Change-Id: I47ad69355a17eada1f5d00cc627929131018285c

subject: fix bug that new nova instance cannot get ip address in multinodes   - In multinodes, the flood flow rule is not generated correctly.   - When node instance starts, it sends dhcp broadcast request to   - dhcp agent. The broadcast packet drops in br-tun because there   - is only default rule to deal with flood packet in br-tun.   - The reason is ovs-agent uses mod-flow to add flood flow but   - in openvswitch 2.4. The behavior is a little different from   - openvswitch 2.0. It will not add a new flow rule if there is no   - matching in existing flow rules. The change to to change the   - ovs action to install flood entry from mod-flow to add-flow.   - The updated action behaves similar as other ovs actions like   - installing unicast entry or installing arp responder entry.

  - The reason is ovs-agent uses mod-flow to add flood flow but
  - in openvswitch 2.4. The behavior is a little different from
  - openvswitch 2.0. It will not add a new flow rule if there is no

  - ovs action to install flood entry from mod-flow to add-flow.
  - The updated action behaves similar as other ovs actions like

Change-Id: Id8e9f86c342ce7a6df592bd3aa7e118c4ba1fd6d

commit_message:
fix bug that new nova instance cannot get ip address in multinodes
  - In multinodes, the flood flow rule is not generated correctly.
  - When node instance starts, it sends dhcp broadcast request to
  - dhcp agent. The broadcast packet drops in br-tun because there
  - is only default rule to deal with flood packet in br-tun.
  - The reason is ovs-agent uses mod-flow to add flood flow but
  - in openvswitch 2.4. The behavior is a little different from
  - openvswitch 2.0. It will not add a new flow rule if there is no
  - matching in existing flow rules. The change to to change the
  - ovs action to install flood entry from mod-flow to add-flow.
  - The updated action behaves similar as other ovs actions like
  - installing unicast entry or installing arp responder entry.

Change-Id: Id8e9f86c342ce7a6df592bd3aa7e118c4ba1fd6d
Closes-Bug: #1576901

commit_message:
Fix multiple create server tests for all extension

Multiple create server sample tests does not consider the all
extension enable.

As API doc should consider the response with all extension enabled,
this tests should generate the sample file with all extension enabled.

This commit fix the multiple create server tests for the same.

NOTE- In future, all nova sample tests will be fixed to run against
all extension. Some cases like this which does not have sample file
for all extension will be fixed now to make API doc consistent.

Change-Id: I5b95db289452459e0317715a5fb8b734dc21e1aa
Related-Bug: #1505881

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-04 06:46:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'check instances az when updating host aggregate

The az for the host may be changed due to use host aggregates,
and we should check the az for the instances located on this host,
to make sure the az for the instances will not conflict with the
az of the aggregate.
eg: add host1 to the aggregate agg1, and set the az of agg1 to az1, then
schedule an instance named instance1 to host1 with specified az as az1,
at this time, if we remove host1 from agg1, the az for instance1 is still
az1, and later if we add host1 to agg2 with az2, the az for instance1 will
be conflict with host1.

Change-Id: I636ae0e0489bcf816cd1f16fb5f1840f26c42d00
Closes-Bug: #1444841
'}]
commit_message:
check instances az when updating host aggregate

The az for the host may be changed due to use host aggregates,
and we should check the az for the instances located on this host,
to make sure the az for the instances will not conflict with the
az of the aggregate.
eg: add host1 to the aggregate agg1, and set the az of agg1 to az1, then
schedule an instance named instance1 to host1 with specified az as az1,
at this time, if we remove host1 from agg1, the az for instance1 is still
az1, and later if we add host1 to agg2 with az2, the az for instance1 will
be conflict with host1.

Change-Id: I636ae0e0489bcf816cd1f16fb5f1840f26c42d00
Closes-Bug: #1444841

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-25 09:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': "VMware: Ensure all the disk files of VM could be deleted along with VM deletion

Sometimes openstack users will add disks for VM via vcenter to other datastores
which the VM doesn't locate, in this situation, if VM is deleted in openstack,
only the disk files in same datastore with VM will got deleted, while the disk
files in different datastores with VM won't be deleted. Although it's
an un-recommended operation, in order to make the program more robust,

Change-Id: I7b08204e07138f26ccb5cead842fa7bd6dfeb0d9
Closes-Bug: #1498752
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Ensure all the disk files of VM could be deleted along with VM deletion

Sometimes openstack users will add disks for VM via vcenter to other datastores
which the VM doesn't locate, in this situation, if VM is deleted in openstack,
only the disk files in same datastore with VM will got deleted, while the disk
files in different datastores with VM won't be deleted. Although it's
an un-recommended operation, in order to make the program more robust,
we should make all the disk files of VM deleted along with VM deletion.

Change-Id: I7b08204e07138f26ccb5cead842fa7bd6dfeb0d9
Closes-Bug: #1498752

This allows the keymanager to use the default key size of 256
when requesting a key. The default configuration value of 512
bits for XTS mode encryption is erroneously passed on to the
key manager, 512 bits is not a valid size for AES keys.

The actual desired key length is passed through to dmcrypt
separately, so this change wont effect the actual encryption key
strength used to protect an ephemeral volume.

Change-Id: Ia44b3f84f8f7699c1b712ce6af00c65eedce7a91
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the key manager to default on key size

This allows the keymanager to use the default key size of 256
when requesting a key. The default configuration value of 512
bits for XTS mode encryption is erroneously passed on to the
key manager, 512 bits is not a valid size for AES keys.

The actual desired key length is passed through to dmcrypt
separately, so this change wont effect the actual encryption key
strength used to protect an ephemeral volume.

Change-Id: Ia44b3f84f8f7699c1b712ce6af00c65eedce7a91

commit_message:
Only run mistral commands if mistral is enabled

The mistral cli commands to load the workbooks and workflows should only
be run if enable_mistral is true. Otherwise, the commands fail since
mistral is not installed and the undercloud install ultimately fails as
well.

Change-Id: If25fdd8f596d594090cd177e0b024322a4411297

commit_message:
DB:support for migration objects multi-statuses

This commit adds a method to get migration objects with several
instance_uuids in mutiple states.

It adds migration_get_by_instances_with_multiple_statuses()
in db to avoid multiple database queries for the multiple status.
This method can get migrate objects in the one of several status.
Such as 'post-migrating', 'finished', 'reverting', and 'reverted'.

It also adds get_by_instances_with_multiple_statuses() in object
to avoid multiple database queries for the multiple status.

Co-Authored-By:Kevin_Zheng<zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ia15b6ec653dcf42090dabdcca7e9f8c555369dad
Partial-bug:#1425859

commit_message:
Make pause_server a blocking call

Some drivers do not support pause_instance. Currently the
pause_instance rpc method is a non-blocking cast. This
prevents exceptions from propagating to the user as it
immediately returns an HTTP Accepted response. This patch
makes the pause_instance method a blocking call to allow
exceptions to reach the user.

Change-Id: Ib208bc4ab6b8659ccdfdf5f3411bb7fb8833c2a7
Parital-Bug:#1310131

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-06 08:47:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/deferred_delete.py', 'nova/compute/task_states.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Allow force-delete irrespective of VM task_state

Cannot delete vm instance if duplicate delete requests are sent.

When user sends request to delete an instance, its task_state gets
changed to 'deleting' state. When an instance task_state is already in
'deleting' state and if at that moment the rabbitmq-server get crashed
by some reasons, then the instance task_state remains in 'deleting'
state and user won't be able to delete the instance forever.

At this moment, there is only one way to delete the instances, whose
task_state is 'deleting' state, by restarting the nova-compute
services where these instances are running.

To avoid restarting the nova-compute service manually, modified the
force-delete api to allow instance deletion irrespective of
instance task_state.

Added new instance task_state 'force-deleting' (which is set if instance
is deleted using force_delete api) to ignore duplicate force-delete
requests and still allowing retry on regular delete request.

Change-Id: I302a3a21fd117df7edfd0c4d8a40fd0efb4c794e
Closes-Bug: 1431860
"}]
commit_message:
Allow force-delete irrespective of VM task_state

Cannot delete vm instance if duplicate delete requests are sent.

When user sends request to delete an instance, its task_state gets
changed to 'deleting' state. When an instance task_state is already in
'deleting' state and if at that moment the rabbitmq-server get crashed
by some reasons, then the instance task_state remains in 'deleting'
state and user won't be able to delete the instance forever.

At this moment, there is only one way to delete the instances, whose
task_state is 'deleting' state, by restarting the nova-compute
services where these instances are running.

To avoid restarting the nova-compute service manually, modified the
force-delete api to allow instance deletion irrespective of
instance task_state.

Added new instance task_state 'force-deleting' (which is set if instance
is deleted using force_delete api) to ignore duplicate force-delete
requests and still allowing retry on regular delete request.

Change-Id: I302a3a21fd117df7edfd0c4d8a40fd0efb4c794e
Closes-Bug: 1431860

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-31 17:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/instancejobtracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Use psutil and TERM to KILL backoff loop

Instead of directly trying to SIGKILL a active rsync/scp process
it is nicer to first try to give that process a SIGTERM so that it
can shutdown in a nice manner (then wait for it to respond) and then
if it still has not responded attempt to SIGKILL it. This adds that
loop to do just this.

It also moves toward using psutil (already a requirement) to do the
process term/kill and process location work, since that library already
does this in a way that works across operating systems and ensures that
pids are not reused while the kill/term loop is active.

Change-Id: I963b396f44a1b0cc05cf8697416772f55a0465c7
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use psutil and TERM to KILL backoff loop

Instead of directly trying to SIGKILL a active rsync/scp process
it is nicer to first try to give that process a SIGTERM so that it
can shutdown in a nice manner (then wait for it to respond) and then
if it still has not responded attempt to SIGKILL it. This adds that
loop to do just this.

It also moves toward using psutil (already a requirement) to do the
process term/kill and process location work, since that library already
does this in a way that works across operating systems and ensures that
pids are not reused while the kill/term loop is active.

Change-Id: I963b396f44a1b0cc05cf8697416772f55a0465c7

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-24 14:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/objects/bandwidth_usage.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/313_drop_shadow_bw_usage_cache.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_bandwidth_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove SoftDeleteMixin from BandwidthUsage

This class is never soft-deleted, so it doesn't need the mixin.

It should be OK to remove the columns from the model (by removing the
mixin) because they have not been used for over a cycle (in fact, ever).
Doing this should result in an automatic schema contraction.

By the same token, it should be OK to remove shadow_bw_usage_cache as
nothing has ever been soft-deleted so this table should be empty.

Change-Id: Ib6011a89f73d401334874d719721e41dc0483dc2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove SoftDeleteMixin from BandwidthUsage

This class is never soft-deleted, so it doesn't need the mixin.

It should be OK to remove the columns from the model (by removing the
mixin) because they have not been used for over a cycle (in fact, ever).
Doing this should result in an automatic schema contraction.

By the same token, it should be OK to remove shadow_bw_usage_cache as
nothing has ever been soft-deleted so this table should be empty.

Change-Id: Ib6011a89f73d401334874d719721e41dc0483dc2

commit_message:
xenapi: add created tag on cached images

Adds created time string on cached vdi. This allows
for time based cleanup of old cache. Current method
of cleanup can be modified to implement a time based
cleanp such that image > X seconds can be cleaned.

Change-Id: I76e78fbb92faefe30842ac08f426760ac3a17769
