commit_message:
add support for muti_statuses_query from migration

This commit adds a method to get migration
objects in the one of several status from a list of instances
It adds get_by_instances_with_multiple_statuses() in object to
to avoid multiple database queries for the multiple status.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: If3cbe9da92d0f05677df9dca07c15b4e497546d2
Closes-Bug: #1425859

On build, decrement a cell's available ram slots. Using the scheduler_count
configuration option the available capacity per cell is effectively divided
per scheduler. This prevents multiple schedulers from flooding the same cell

the entirety of the capacity allocated to it, begin consuming per cell
capacity reserved for other schedulers.

Scheduling larger instances will consume both the larger slot as well as
each of the smaller slots reported (e.g. a build request for a 2048 slot
will also consume two 1024 slots and four 512 slots).

commit_message:
Cells: Decrement available slots

On build, decrement a cell's available ram slots. Using the scheduler_count
configuration option the available capacity per cell is effectively divided
per scheduler. This prevents multiple schedulers from flooding the same cell
with build requests that exceed the capacity. Iff a scheduler has consumed
the entirety of the capacity allocated to it, begin consuming per cell
capacity reserved for other schedulers.

Scheduling larger instances will consume both the larger slot as well as
each of the smaller slots reported (e.g. a build request for a 2048 slot
will also consume two 1024 slots and four 512 slots).

Co-author: Ben Roble <ben.roble@rackspace.com>
Co-author: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.co.uk>

Implements: blueprint cells-decrement-ram-slots

Change-Id: I1225337382241772da903b80f04c348e99210e1e

commit_message:
Cells: report capped units and max builds

Currently due to the io_ops and num_instances scheduler filters, we have an
effective capacity that is lower than our actual capacity. Account for the
limits as capped units reported up to the cells scheduler. Also report the
max builds a cell can support at the given time.

Implements: blueprint cells-report-capped-units-and-max-builds

Change-Id: I9ea2179e61244b23b9301e9bff48427eae610621

subject: Fix error in restarting SoftwareDeployment resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-29 08:03:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py'], 'message': "Fix error in restarting SoftwareDeployment resource

During restart resource by stack.restart_resource(), it will destroy
and recreate the resource. For SoftwareDeployment resource,it deletes
the resource from db during delete process, and then it comes to
recreate it, and because its resource_id is still the previous one,
not none, so SoftwareDeployment try to update it, then failed at
show_software_deployment() due to the resource can't be found.

Change-Id: I4051e50884ab300a11d6b1a5904ad182d63c9d2a
Closes-Bug: #1511246
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error in restarting SoftwareDeployment resource

During restart resource by stack.restart_resource(), it will destroy
and recreate the resource. For SoftwareDeployment resource,it deletes
the resource from db during delete process, and then it comes to
recreate it, and because its resource_id is still the previous one,
not none, so SoftwareDeployment try to update it, then failed at
show_software_deployment() due to the resource can't be found.

Change-Id: I4051e50884ab300a11d6b1a5904ad182d63c9d2a
Closes-Bug: #1511246

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 1.7.1

Release 1.7.0 introduced a change to be able to
specify more options when uploading a volume image.
The options were added in a backward incompatible
way, making this break previous deployments.

This release fixes that call to allow the client to
work with older versions.

Change-Id: I47c17a4d283123ebdfb98d35f8107baa246d26a5

subject: Refactorize Puppet versions testing matrix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 15:25:25.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Refactorize Puppet versions testing matrix

* Run puppet-unit-latest only on master, as non-voting.
  The goal of this job is to test very latest versions of Puppet and
  provide early feedback.
* On master (current Newton), stop running unit tests on 3.3, 3.4, 3.7
  and 4.0. A recent poll showed that 3.6, 3.8 and recent 4.x were the
  most used by our community.
* On stable/mitaka and master (current Newton), start running unit tests
  on 4.5 (latest version) as voting.

Coverage summary:
Liberty: 3.3, 3.4, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 4.0
Mitaka: 3.3, 3.4, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 4.0, 4.5
Newton: 3.6, 3.8, 4.5 and latest (non-voting)

Change-Id: I093f2791723172b4995adc5b73fa5e23623e0614
'}]
commit_message:
Refactorize Puppet versions testing matrix

* Run puppet-unit-latest only on master, as non-voting.
  The goal of this job is to test very latest versions of Puppet and
  provide early feedback.
* On master (current Newton), stop running unit tests on 3.3, 3.4, 3.7
  and 4.0. A recent poll showed that 3.6, 3.8 and recent 4.x were the
  most used by our community.
* On stable/mitaka and master (current Newton), start running unit tests
  on 4.5 (latest version) as voting.

Coverage summary:
Liberty: 3.3, 3.4, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 4.0
Mitaka: 3.3, 3.4, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 4.0, 4.5
Newton: 3.6, 3.8, 4.5 and latest (non-voting)

Change-Id: I093f2791723172b4995adc5b73fa5e23623e0614

commit_message:
puppet/experimental: deploy puppet4

We're working on getting Puppet Beaker jobs working on Ubuntu Xenial.

Current jobs are broken because:
* https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/BKR-821
* Puppetlabs does not package Puppet3 for Ubuntu Xenial

This patch aims to deploy Puppet4 so we can make progress on running
beaker jobs on Ubuntu Xenial until BKR-821 is fixed (we'll probably try
to run Puppet3 again on Xenial).

Change-Id: Id0573e491bba954ab87b8b3905b555c77c361858

subject: Instead of a multiprocessing queue use sockets via asyncore
revisions:
[{'number': 34, 'created': '2016-05-24 23:17:06.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'doc/source/engines.rst', 'taskflow/tests/unit/action_engine/test_creation.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_engines.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/process_executor.py', 'taskflow/tests/utils.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/executor.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/action_engine/test_process_executor.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_worker.py', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': 'Instead of a multiprocessing queue use sockets via asyncore

For a local process based executor usage currently to ensure
that task emitted notifications are proxied we use the multi
processing library and use its queue concept. This sadly creates
a proxy process that gets associated, and this proxy process
handles the queue and messages sent to and from it. Instead of
doing this we can instead just create a temporary local socket
using a random socket and have tasks (which are running in
different processes) use that to communicate back any emitted
notifications instead (and we can use the asyncore module to handle
the emitted notifications since it handles the lower level socket
reading, polling and dispatching).

To ensure that the socket created is somewhat secure we use a
similar process as the multi-processing library uses where we
sign all messages with a hmac that uses a one time key that only
the main process and the child process know about (and reject
any messages that do not validate using this key).

Change-Id: Iff9180054bf14495e5667af00ae2fafbdbc23791
'}]
commit_message:
Instead of a multiprocessing queue use sockets via asyncore

For a local process based executor usage currently to ensure
that task emitted notifications are proxied we use the multi
processing library and use its queue concept. This sadly creates
a proxy process that gets associated, and this proxy process
handles the queue and messages sent to and from it. Instead of
doing this we can instead just create a temporary local socket
using a random socket and have tasks (which are running in
different processes) use that to communicate back any emitted
notifications instead (and we can use the asyncore module to handle
the emitted notifications since it handles the lower level socket
reading, polling and dispatching).

To ensure that the socket created is somewhat secure we use a
similar process as the multi-processing library uses where we
sign all messages with a hmac that uses a one time key that only
the main process and the child process know about (and reject
any messages that do not validate using this key).

Change-Id: Iff9180054bf14495e5667af00ae2fafbdbc23791

commit_message:
Don't load DNS integration in l3_router_plugin

In this patchset we stop the l3_router_plugin from loading the DNS integration
extension. The DNS integration extension should only be configured by the
operator by adding 'dns' to the 'extension_driver' list in ml2_conf.ini

Change-Id: I1321d9821973fe918005a8c2f3dd751af9affe38
Closes-Bug: #1574694

commit_message:
Ensure that the base connector is platform independent

This change pulls the Linux specific methods out of the base
initiator connector, moving them to a new class.

This will allow us to easily add Windows connectors.

Partial-Implements: blueprint os-brick-windows-support

Change-Id: Id0acd52a352f837897255f485f46285602468c63

commit_message:
Add ironic cleaning job

This patch adds tempest-dsvm-ironic-cleaning-nv job.
Job is added to Ironic project experimental pipeline.
Once test is stabilized job will be switched to voting mode.

Ironic is configured with cleaning enabled:
 automated_clean = True
 erase_devices_priority = 1

Job will launch BaremetalCleaning tempest scenario [0]:
 1. Boot instance
 2. Verify partitions on it
 3. Terminate instance
 5. Check that partition table is removed.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/304469/

Change-Id: Iba7179baee23cb5979cf4c451e24142c00f664ef
Partial-Bug: #1523640

subject: Fix package reference in version code
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 15:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer_powervm/version.py', 'requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix package reference in version code

The package version file erroneously contained quotes here:

version_info = pbr.version.VersionInfo('__package__')

This caused docs builds using setuptools at or beyond 20.2 to fail with:

pkg_resources.RequirementParseError: Invalid requirement, parse error at
"'__packag'"

This change set remedies the line to refer to __package__ (a builtin
variable which resolves to the package name) rather than the literal
string '__package__':

version_info = pbr.version.VersionInfo(__package__)

...and updates the requirements file to use a setuptools version at or
beyond 16.0 to align with openstack's global requirements.

Change-Id: I9ba12bb256c5d3213eb07ddf13351178bf06114b
Closes-Bug: 1585027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix package reference in version code

The package version file erroneously contained quotes here:

version_info = pbr.version.VersionInfo('__package__')

This caused docs builds using setuptools at or beyond 20.2 to fail with:

pkg_resources.RequirementParseError: Invalid requirement, parse error at
"'__packag'"

This change set remedies the line to refer to __package__ (a builtin
variable which resolves to the package name) rather than the literal
string '__package__':

version_info = pbr.version.VersionInfo(__package__)

...and updates the requirements file to use a setuptools version at or
beyond 16.0 to align with openstack's global requirements.

Change-Id: I9ba12bb256c5d3213eb07ddf13351178bf06114b
Closes-Bug: 1585027

commit_message:
Make RandomString get_resource/get_attr equivalent

Post-create, get_resource and get_attr: [r_string, value] behave the
same. Do the same for pre-create, which right now can return None and
break validation.

Change-Id: I0caa53dfc3fd2a3ccb29b0d107150ed57124480e
Closes-bug: #1489396
